title: Program Support Specialist
description:
**Job Description:**

* Review all participant files to ensure accuracy of data migrated from SPARQ to GPMS.
* Track durational limit, slots, new intakes, exits and follow-ups.
* Assist with ensuring GPMS data entry and participant files and information is entered timely and accurately.
* Communicate with management and staff effectively both verbally and in writing.
* Provide consistent project management guidance, methods, system tools, and metrics for consistent project outcomes.
* Develop methods for measuring effectiveness and sustainability and conduct periodic assessments.
* Create Executive Level excel dashboards to report overall program health.
* Assist in identification and analysis of program level risks and opportunities.
* Provide technical assistance to program staff on an as needed basis.
* Meet work standards by following productivity and quality of program data.
* Identify operational problems and work process improvements.
* Evaluate and assess the programs’ strengths and weaknesses.
* Meet with program staff to discuss program status and goals
* Complete other duties as assigned by Management.

**Skills required:**

* All of the above; IT experience is a plus.
* Microsoft Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, GPMS, DocuSign, AOSOS, etc.

**Experience required:** 

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in providing technical assistance.
* Experience in data validating information across various program systems.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to work well with a team and independently.
* Computer proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Teams.
* Ability to schedule and manage tasks effectively.
* Conflict resolution and problem-solving skills.
* Organizational and multitasking skills.

**Work hours:**

* 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM
* Lunch period (Unpaid):1/2HR

**Additional information:**

* Hybrid : Work remotely 2 to 3 days per week

**About Us:** 

We are specialized in recruiting and deliver the best professional talent of industry and we are committed to deliver best experience for our clients and job seekers. With over two decades of experience in the recruitment industry, we proudly help you to find the next job that matches your professional skills. Our team understands your needs or requirement before starting the recruitment, that enables to find the high quality of talent with high success rate of talent delivery, keeps us continue to be the best in the industry.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $34.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Ability to Relocate:

* Union, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Supervisor
description:

The main purpose of the Supervisor is:

* Assist in creating a meaningful and impactful learning experiences for guests, ensuring children gain practical skills and knowledge through hands-on activities and real-world applications.
* Train and mentor, the Learning Ambassadors on new learnings modules and maintaining high standards of guest engagement.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Conduct training sessions and workshops for staff development.
* Provide ongoing support and guidance to ensure high-quality program delivery.
* Provide feedback to team members and resolve team member performance issues.
* Document performance
* Maintain performance files and records for department team members.
* Coach, train and mentor employees.
* Write Team Member performance reviews on an annual basis.

* Foster a supportive and inclusive learning environment.
* Develop and maintain relationships with guests to enhance their learning experience.
* Organize and facilitate guest activities, workshops, and events.

title: Sales
description:
e乡e家，为你寻找海外的另一个家。

Connect Dream Home.

What is Ehomie?

Ehomie is an internet-based real estate company based in New York City. Starting in 2016, we are creating the future of real estate and connecting dream homes globally.

We specialize in cross-border relocation information for college students and young professionals. Over 400,000 users post and share housing information on Ehomie App. Our real estate experts, equipped with the latest tech, find your dream homes efficiently.

What we do?

Ehomie is filling the information gap for cross-border home hunting. Ehomie WeChat App creates an online community, allowing users to find and sublease homes, search for roommates, and trade used items for free.

Ehomie real estate professionals offer rental and buying in New York, Massachusetts, and Illinois. Our comprehensive services include in-person and virtual tours and roommate matching. We also have partners providing moving, cleaning, furniture, etc., helping our clients move into their new homes smoothly and worry-free.

Why us?

* Find your mates. Work with an exciting team. Find your business partners and team members. Start your own business today. We got your back.
* Customers like us. Work in a company with great brand recognition and tons of positive reviews.
* Popular Ehomie App. Work with customers from Ehomie App. We help you reach out to new customers as well.
* Technology makes us better. We have real-time updated listings, free e-signing potential customers contacts, etc. Our CRM helps you manage deals and clients data efficiently. Save more time and make more money.
* Dedicated support teams. You have support from our marketing, recruiting, and coordinating teams. They handle many details for each deal, so you can focus on big pictures.
* Exclusive listings. Close more deals with our exclusive listings as there are more options for clients.
* Free trainings. New to real estate? Not a problem! We have mentors, online courses, experts sessions and training meetings, all free.
* Best locations. Time Square Plaza, Boston Downtown, Chicago River. You can easily find us, so do our customers.

我们是谁？

Ehomie，e乡e家，一个领先的房产信息及交易服务开放平台，专注于为海外留学生寻找理想房屋并提供衍生服务。通过建立开放平台，用数据和技术助力个人、经纪人及品牌公寓发展业务。

公司2016年成立于纽约曼哈顿，总部分别位于纽约和北京。旗下拥有e乡e家网、ehomie小程序、ehomie转租，当前用户超过40万，平台全球开放。用户可以在ehomie小程序上免费搜索、发布房源，匹配室友，二手物品交易，直播看房答疑。

我们专业的市场销售团队，为客户提供最新最全的房源信息和完善的配套服务。我们还配备了搬家、清洁和家具等入住服务，让客户入住无忧。

为什么加入我们？

* 与有趣的灵魂相遇。我们的团队成员来自不同的专业背景，是你的校友，更是与你一起并肩作战共同成长的伙伴。招募自己的团队成员，在公司内部开启创业第一弹。
* 优质的品牌形象。我们为客户提供优质诚意服务，在留学生群体广受好评。
* 庞大的用户基础。公司平台有大量的用户支持，ehomie小程序是留学生找房二手必备。
* 科技支持，提升效率。公司提供房源更新实时自动提醒，CRM客户管理系统，线上协议签约，潜在客户搜索等，大大提升工作效率。
* 支持团队，实时在线。我们的运营、招募、整合、售后团队，为你提供全方位专业支持。
* 独家房源，更多选择。我们与多家开发公司合作，为客户提供更多独家房源选择。
* 免费培训，持续助力。新手无忧，我们有一对一培训，线上课程，主题讲座，与专业培训师、各领域专家交流，全面提升工作技巧与专业知识。
* 高端办公地点。纽约时代广场，波士顿市中心，芝加哥河畔。交通便利，助力业务成功。
* 支持CPT/OPT工作，H1B Sponsorship。

Responsibilities

* Be part of the most exciting real estate team and grow your network.
* Post engaging content on social media and build personal branding.
* Work with qualified clients from Ehomie App and our marketing team.
* Tailor the rental and buying solutions based on individual customer needs.
* Show apartments and houses and oversee the transactions for a smooth customer experience.
* Develop and maintain business relationships with owners and properties.
* Fully utilize our free tech supports, such as CRM system, and exclusive listings, to escalate sales opportunities.
* You will be supported by your mentor and our dedicated teams all the way long. And you can always start building and leading your own team.

我们的工作内容有

* 与不同专业背景的团队合作，拓展人脉资源。
* 运营社交媒体平台、Ehomie小程序私域流量，打造个人IP。
* 为公司平台和运营团队提供的优质客户提供房屋租赁买卖服务。
* 根据客户需求提供最佳租售方案。
* 实地看房，跟进交易流程，提升客户体验。
* 与房东、公寓公司开发维护合作关系。
* 充分发挥公司技术支持、独家房源优势，收获更多销售机遇。
* 团队持续支持，支持组建个人团队，在公司内部创业。

Qualifications

* Bachelors' degree, fresh graduates or no experience welcome.
* Real estate license holder or in the process of earning it.
* Excellent commutation skills, energetic team player.
* Knowledge of local neighborhoods or strong interest in real estate.
* Self-motivated, entrepreneurial spirit.

我们希望你是

* 本科及以上毕业，新人欢迎，无经验要求。
* 持有有效地产经纪执照，或在准备考试。
* 强大的沟通协调能力，重视团队协作。
* 了解本区域市场或者对地产行业充满热情。
* 自驱力，创业者精神加分项。

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

title: Adult Day Care Registered Nurse
description:
***REGISTERED NURSE***

Provides for the establishment and in the Medical Day Care Center’s maintenance of nursing care under the general and direct supervision of the Director of Nursing.

Responsibilities:

* Provide or supervise the nursing care of each program participant
* Participate in the quality assurance program for client care, as well as in the development and review of the participant's care plans.
* Maintains proper attendance including punctuality to ensure that the facility is operated in an efficient and cost-effective manner
* Participate in the distribution, administration, and storage of all medications.
* Advise the Administrator/Director of Nursing of medical and related Problems.
* Encourage and coordinate the keeping of Scheduled appointments and having prescriptions filled promptly.
* Note any significant changes in the participant's behavior and condition and report them to the Director of Nursing.
* Ensure the completion and accuracy of the participant's medical records as well as proving for their secure storage and confidentiality.
* Assist as necessary in the delivery of other center services.
* Attend Inter-Disciplinary Team meetings as directed by the Director of Nursing, as well as staff meetings, as scheduled.

**Abilities:**

* Must be able to communicate effectively and tactfully with others within the office and with the public.
* Ability to organize his/her time, be able to organize workload and determine the priority of duties.
* Must be of good moral character, have a pleasing personality, and be able to follow verbal and written instructions, as well as give verbal and written instructions to staff in an organized and appropriate manner.
* Able to work in a large open office with stress factors of telephone calls, noise generated by computer printers, and demands of members and staff.

**Worker Characteristics:**

* Must be thoughtful of others, gentle, courteous, patient, neat, well-groomed, healthy, tactful, friendly, and of average intelligence and with a good memory.
* Must be able to reach for items in storage cabinets above shoulder height.
* Sufficient visual ability to be able to use a computer or typewriter.
* Sufficient audio ability to be able to answer telephone calls and be able to respond to any audio alarms that go off in the office.

title: Data Scientist - Ecommerce
description:
We are a high volume, Brooklyn-based Ecommerce company that sells a wide variety of products across several online platforms (Amazon, Ebay, Walmart.com, etc.). Specializing in photography, electronics, audio, and houseware products, Focus Camera is a globally recognized brand with the heart of a brick-and-mortar family store.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in our Brooklyn, NY headquarters.

In this role, you will be the lead member of our Data Science Team and work with our Ecommerce Managers to analyze and report on sales, promotion (PPC and sponsored ads), and pricing data to inform business decisions.

Responsibilities:

* Extract data from various advertising platforms and internal databases using SQL and Python to identify trends or anomalies and deliver actionable insights.
* Utilize SQL, Python, and Excel to maintain existing ETL pipelines.
* Maintain and improve internal dashboards used for tracking advertisement performance metrics.
* Perform ad-hoc data analysis and reporting tasks as needed to support business decisions and strategy.
* Work closely with team members and/or other departments to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.
* Contribute to process improvements and suggest enhancements for reporting and data management practices.
* Assist with implementing new strategies to achieve sales and marketing goals.

Requirements:

* 3-5 years experience using Python or R\\* for data ingestion, analysis, and reporting (Python is used in this role)
* 3-5 years experience using SQL for data ingestion and analysis (MySQL and Microsoft SQL preferred)
* 3+ years experience using Excel for data analysis and reporting
* Experience using PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
* Experience with eCommerce advertising
* Experience with any Cloud Computing service (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Experience with Bayesian statistics or regression analysis

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Python: 3 years (Preferred)
* SQL: 3 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11218 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Negotiator -- Merchant Cash
description:
We are a full-service, high-volume law firm located in the Financial District of New York City. We specialize in providing representation to small businesses and business owners who find themselves in financial difficulty due to debt service.

We are looking for individuals who have an aptitude for negotiations to join our team as a Negotiator, primarily in merchant cash advance (“MCA”) cases on a project to project basis. The Negotiator will conduct a high volume of negotiations with MCA companies and their agents on behalf of our client business owners to reach satisfactory settlements for those clients. This position is anticipated to be part-time on a project-to-project basis. The ideal candidate is looking for a fast-paced environment and has a genuine desire to help people in difficult times.

Responsibilities:

· Manage merchant cash advance (“MCA”) cases.

· Establish and maintain regular contact with our clients to gather facts, understand clients’ individual situations and availability of funds, and generate client settlement offers and proposals.

· Review and analyze legal documents, including MCA agreements, complaints, judgments, settlement agreements, and releases under the supervision of attorneys.

· Gather required legal documents for approval and completion of settlements.

· Establish and maintain regular contact with MCA companies and their agents to negotiate and reach satisfactory settlements for our clients.

· Maintain follow-ups with MCA companies, their agents, and our clients as needed to see settlement negotiation through to completion.

· Coordinate with banks, attorneys, legal representatives, court officials, and other third parties as needed.

Job Requirements

· Bachelor’s Degree preferred.

· Experience with or exposure to negotiation, collections, judgment recovery, and legal work is preferred, but no previous legal experience is required.

· Experience with or exposure to MCA companies is a major plus.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including experience with phone conversation.

· Ability to work independently without supervision, solid work ethic, and competitive drive.

· Strong interpersonal skills with ability to easily build rapport and maintain working relationships.

· Ability to adapt to changes on a rolling basis.

· Strong attention to detail and time management skills.

· Ability to work well with others and take direction well.

If you are a results-oriented individual with a passion for negotiation and building strong client relationships, we would love to hear from you.

This is a great part-time opportunity for an experienced negotiator to assist small businesses in a growing and thriving practice. The job is fast-paced and rewarding. Pay is consummate with experience and includes both a hourly / project fee and bonuses.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 15 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Accountant
description:
**Accountant**

Chery Equipment Group

Garden City, New York, United States (On-site)

**Company Details:**

Chery Equipment Group is a US distributor of globally recognized heavy equipment and industrial product.

We are a growing and dynamic company with two distinct business divisions: Chery Forklift, specializing in the sales and rental of heavy equipment and tools, and Chery Industrial, offering a wide range of industrial products.

Chery Equipment Group is looking for an accountant who will be able to apply experience and sound judgement to manage timely and accurate financial reporting tasks. The ideal candidate will be well-organized with a strong sense of accuracy, pays attention to detail, comfortable multitasking, and meeting deadlines.

**Responsibilities**

* Work closely with Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable staff to complete all accounting transactions monthly, quarterly, and yearly
* Reconcile all bank accounts; review and validate accounts receivable, accounts payable, inventory and fixed asset balances
* Post all transactions to the general ledger; make the necessary recurring and accrual entries
* Review and analyze monthly financial reports and compare the results with sales department reports; communicate significant variances on a timely basis
* Assist and work directly with company CEO with ad hoc financial reports and estimates
* Work with Finance Manager to help support the overall department goals and objectives; work with company’s CPA with reports and estimations
* Help Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable staff, and work with departmental managers when necessary

**Qualifications**

* **Bilingual in Mandarin and English**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Accounting, or related field
* 3+ years of experience in accounting
* Advanced or intermedia Excel skills. Proficient in Google Suites. Yongyou ERP a plus.
* Supervisory experience is preferred but not required.

**Pay:** $70,000-$75,000

*Chery Equipment Group is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. Chery Equipment Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Chery Equipment Group conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.*

title: IT MSP Lead Dispatcher
description:
**Join Our Dynamic Team as an IT MSP Lead Service Dispatcher!** 

Are you an organized multitasker with a knack for problem-solving and a passion for technology? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments and love leading a team to success? If so, we want you to be our next IT MSP Lead Service Dispatcher!

**What We Offer:**

* **Exciting Challenges:** Every day brings a new opportunity to solve complex issues and support a diverse range of clients.
* **Collaborative Culture:** Work with a vibrant team of tech enthusiasts who value creativity, teamwork, and a positive attitude.
* **Career Growth:** With us, you'll have the chance to advance your career in the IT industry and gain valuable experience in a leadership role.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Enjoy a flexible schedule and a supportive environment that values your well-being.

**Your Mission:**

As our Lead Service Dispatcher, you'll be at the heart of our operations, ensuring that service requests are handled efficiently and effectively. You'll coordinate with our talented team of technicians, manage incoming support tickets, and prioritize tasks to keep our clients happy and their IT systems running smoothly. Your leadership skills will shine as you guide and motivate your team, driving exceptional service delivery

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Dispatch Magic:** Assign service tickets to the right technicians based on expertise and availability.
* **Team Leadership:** Mentor and support your team, fostering a collaborative and productive work environment.
* **Client Communication:** Serve as a point of contact for clients, addressing their needs and ensuring a top-notch experience.
* **Performance Tracking:** Monitor service metrics and implement strategies to improve efficiency and client satisfaction.

**What You Bring:**

* **IT Expertise:** A solid understanding of IT systems and troubleshooting.
* **Leadership Skills:** Experience in leading or managing a team with a focus on achieving results.
* **Organizational Flair:** Exceptional ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
* **Communication Pro:** Strong verbal and written communication skills, with a knack for problem-solving.

**Why You'll Love Working With Us:**

* **Innovative Environment:** Be part of a forward-thinking company that embraces the latest technology trends.
* **Supportive Team:** Join a group of passionate professionals who are dedicated to helping each other succeed.
* **Fun Atmosphere:** Enjoy team-building activities, company events, and a workplace where your contributions are valued.

Ready to take your career to the next level and lead a team to IT greatness? Apply now and become our IT MSP Lead Service Dispatcher. Let's make IT magic happen together!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

* Vision insurance

title: Freelance Vice President, Project Management
description:
**Company Description**  

CoLab is a fully integrated, cross-discipline team that provides best-in-class services in a fluid and modular way. With our clients at the center, we create brand movement at the speed of people’s lives by connecting real-time data with world-class creative, content, and media in service of growth and Return on investment.


CoLab is a “power of one” solution, encompassing data, media, and production. By drawing from across the vast Publicis Groupe network, we are uniquely positioned to deliver innovation and specialized skills to our clients, as well as enriching opportunities and inclusive benefits to our employees. We pride ourselves on combining the atmosphere of a startup company with the stability and experience of a global leader.

 **Job Description**  

The Vice President, Director is a big picture, strategic thinker who is an account team’s production lead (or multiple accounts depending on the scope and size of the accounts and agency). The VP Director is ultimately responsible for the delivery of high-quality deliverables that power client satisfaction, meet business requirements, and balance client and agency economics. The VP, Director leads a multi-skill (ie online and offline) team of project managers that may include people at the Associate Director level. This person is experienced, works independently, and is considered an “expert” in project management by peers in other capabilities.


Knowledge

* Problem solving: Skillfully identifies and removes barriers to project success
* Corporate leader: Visible leader of high-profile corporate initiatives
* Strategic: Has a firm grasp on the big picture
* PM Approach: Ensures that the project management team utilizes a flexible project management approach
* PM Technical Skills: Solid knowledge and experience in digital and traditional production processes. Leads large teams to drive complex programs/campaigns to completion based on scope and budget. Well-versed in production needs; considered an expert in multiple channels and understands other mediums well enough to be a strategic problem solver
* Talent Selection: Demonstrates the ability to hire and retain highly capable people while fostering diversity and career development
* SOWs: Reviews key team SOWs to ensure accuracy
* Growing talent: Demonstrated ability to grow and develop mid to senior level producer talent
* Client finances: Expert-level portfolio budget management skills
* Technology: Continuously learning technology. Strong understanding of today’s digital technologies


Strategy

* Intellectual capital: Able to turn standard project materials into high-value intellectual capital
* Resource allocation: Reviews all projects across account to determine resource and skill requirements; drives resource allocation management; ensures the right resources are cast to the need
* Project Plans: Accountable for account-level master project plan creation and management.
* Process improvement: Proactively identifies opportunities to adjust processes for efficiencies
* Quality Control: Structures and leads project status reviews; leads cross-team post-mortem sessions
* Informing: Partners with account/ marketing team to provide appropriate and consistent communication directly to client(s) in an effort to clearly manage expectations
* Risk Management: Leads large teams to develop and manage risk mitigation plans


Tactics and Execution

* Resources: Able to roll up resource data on large multi-lane relationships and manage increasing and decreasing resource needs
* Agency Cost management: Vigilantly seeks to optimize both agency services and internal resources
* Internal Relationships and Team Leadership: Collaborative business partner to team capability leads
* Management: Responsible for the career development of others
* Execution: Prioritizes work in progress (WIP) with production and account teams to pull work forward and break bottlenecks
* Vendors: Point of escalation for vendor management concerns
* Scope Definition: Scopes and estimates complex, multi-channel engagements


Client Relationship

* Relationship: Establishes solid, direct relationships with clients
* Team communication: Develops opportunities to expand/improve communication between clients, third parties, and internal team
* Client knowledge: Understands the client’s business and plans projects accordingly
* Passion: Demonstrates passion for the brands and our work
* Problem Solving: Able to drive difficult or complex production discussions with client and facilitate resolution
* New Business: Production lead on new business pitches; identifies upsell opportunities
* Communication and Writing: Uses excellent interpersonal and listening skills

 **Qualifications**  

Requirements


o Proficient level client facing skills


o Expert negotiation and conflict management skills


o Expert in Microsoft Office including Excel and Microsoft Project


o Expert knowledge of digital


o Knowledge of healthcare is required


o Exhibits Integrity and Trust


o Exhibits Self Development

  

Education and Experience


o Bachelors degree required


o Agency experience required


o Healthcare experience preferred


o Significant professional project management experience


o Expert planning, coordination, management, and communication skills are required


o Expert with risk management, change management, communications management

 **Additional Information**  

Publicis Health is the premier global health and wellness communications network. We are one of the four solutions hubs of Publicis Groupe, the third-largest advertising and media company in the world, giving us unparalleled global reach. We manage top-tier agencies specializing in promoting innovative solutions in advertising, medical education, clinical trial program development, sales and marketing, digital, market access, and medical and scientific affairs. Our nearly 6,500 employees work at 15 agency brands across 60 offices located in 10 countries. We are a connected solutions hub, equipped for continual business transformation in today’s world. We integrate services across our global offices and brands to deliver on our clients’ needs. Each of our agencies brings a unique approach to business, which makes us even stronger together. We understand the rapidly changing healthcare environment and leverage it to maximize the potential of our clients’ brands.


Web: www.publicishealth.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/publicishealth Twitter: www.twitter.com/PublicisHealth/

  

Not all applicants will be contacted. PHCG is an equal opportunity employer.


No vendor/agency solicitation please.

title: Seasonal Product Demo Associate // Storyteller - Eataly Flatiron
description:
**Company Description**  

Eataly is the world’s largest artisanal Italian food and beverage marketplace! Eataly is not a chain; each Eataly is different, with its own character and own theme – but all with the same aim... for our guests to:

* EAT authentic Italian food at our restaurants, cafés and to-go counters
* SHOP a selection of high-quality Italian, local and homemade products
* LEARN through our classes and our team’s product knowledge

  

**Job Description**  

A Demo Product Associate is also known as a Storyteller and assists guests with making educated and confident shopping decisions through sharing the stories of the people and places behind Eataly’s products as well as advising on food and beverage pairings.

* Responds courteously to guest inquiries regarding availability, usage of products, the range of services, restaurant offerings, classes at Eataly’s Chef’s Table, recipe help and location of products throughout the market
* Listens actively and asks questions to understand guests’ needs and preferences; recommends food and beverage items
* Develops comprehensive knowledge of Eataly’s products through diligent participation in live and video training and active use of Eataly’s product library
* Communicates daily/monthly new information to Eataly teams
* Prepares and executes product tastings and demonstrations
* Interacts with Eataly teams and vendors, passing information on to Eataly’s Buying, Private Events and Public Relations teams
* Assists with events, such as feste and sagre, and tours for guests
* Circulates store regularly to ensure shopping carts are always available in designated areas
* Opens and closes cash till and ensures an accurate accounting of all transactions, collections and disbursements during the work shift
* Performs other duties as required or assigned

 **Qualifications*** High school diploma or equivalent
* Previous retail and/or restaurant experience preferred
* Knowledge of and passion for Italian food and beverage
* Outstanding communication and relationship-building skills
* Outgoing personality and ability to sell
* Intermediate computer skills


Please be prepared to provide proof of full Covid-19 vaccination upon hire.

 **Additional Information** **Benefits and Perks**

* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* Free family meal daily
* Discounts at Eataly
* Classes on products and Italian cuisine
* Referral bonus program
* Fun staff classes on products and Italian cuisine
* and more!


The base rate for this position is $17-$21


Eataly is an equal employment opportunity employer. It is the Company’s policy to not unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic made unlawful to consider by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Eataly also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also Eataly’s policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding consideration of unemployment status, salary history, credit/bankruptcy history and criminal background/conviction history in making hiring decisions. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Registered Nurse
description:
***REGISTERED NURSE***

Provides for the establishment and in the Medical Day Care Center’s maintenance of nursing care under the general and direct supervision of the Director of Nursing.

Responsibilities:

* Provide or supervise the nursing care of each program participant
* Participate in the quality assurance program for client care, as well as in the development and review of the participant's care plans.
* Maintains proper attendance including punctuality to ensure that the facility is operated in an efficient and cost-effective manner
* Participate in the distribution, administration, and storage of all medications.
* Advise the Administrator/Director of Nursing of medical and related Problems.
* Encourage and coordinate the keeping of Scheduled appointments and having prescriptions filled promptly.
* Note any significant changes in the participant's behavior and condition and report them to the Director of Nursing.
* Ensure the completion and accuracy of the participant's medical records as well as proving for their secure storage and confidentiality.
* Assist as necessary in the delivery of other center services.
* Attend Inter-Disciplinary Team meetings as directed by the Director of Nursing, as well as staff meetings, as scheduled.

**Abilities:**

* Must be able to communicate effectively and tactfully with others within the office and with the public.
* Ability to organize his/her time, be able to organize workload and determine the priority of duties.
* Must be of good moral character, have a pleasing personality, and be able to follow verbal and written instructions, as well as give verbal and written instructions to staff in an organized and appropriate manner.
* Able to work in a large open office with stress factors of telephone calls, noise generated by computer printers, and demands of members and staff.

**Worker Characteristics:**

* Must be thoughtful of others, gentle, courteous, patient, neat, well-groomed, healthy, tactful, friendly, and of average intelligence and with a good memory.

title: 79125- Associate Counsel Level C - Legal Affairs, Claims and Litigation
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

**NYC Health + Hospitals** is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

Summary of Duties and Responsibilities:

Attorney will be assigned to the Claims and Litigation Division of the Office of Legal Affairs. The chosen candidate will be an integral part of a team of litigation associates who manage and handle a case load of complex medical malpractice claims filed against the largest municipal health care system in the country.

**General tasks and responsibilities will include:**

* Work under the supervision of the managing attorney and be expected to handle complex medical malpractice claims from inception through final resolution, including trials.
* Strong medical-legal analytical skills are required.
* This is a litigating position that will require handling a case load, developing defense strategies, recommending and working with medical experts, assessing potential exposure of claims, preparing treating physicians and other medical care providers for depositions and/or trial, and drafting substantive motions.
* This is a senior litigating position that may require training and supervising other members of the litigation team.
* Additional responsibilities of this position may include presenting cases to facilities and senior executives of the Hospital System and working with Risk Management on issues that have the potential for litigation.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. A baccalaureate degree or equivalent, and LLB or JD from an accredited School of  
Law; and admission to New York State Bar; and

2. Three (3) years of experience and background in the practice of law subsequent to  
admission to the Bar in matters of litigation, negligence, corporate law, contracts,  
real estate, labor relations, labor law and employee relations, or

3. Two (2) years of experience and background in the practice of law subsequent to  
admission to the Bar in matters of litigation, negligence, corporate law, contracts,  
real estate, labor relations, employment law and employee relations, with two (2)  
years of progressively responsible experience in a professional or managerial  
capacity in respective fields applicable to the general body of law, specialties or  
practice.

Department Preferences

* 10 or more years medical malpractice defense

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 - $167,300.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Insurance/Collections Accounts Receivable
description:
New York Plastic Surgical Group is looking for a Medical Accounts Receivable to join our Garden City, NY office.

  


**LOCATION**: Garden City/Remote. *HYBRID SCHEDULE*


**\\*Training is** **in the Garden City office** **for approximately 3 months\\***

  


**Why Choose New York Plastic Surgical Group:**


* Annual bonuses based on performance evaluation.
* Insurance, PTO, and holiday pay based on hours worked.
* 401k-4% Company Match
* Deep Blue Med Spa Employee Benefits Program (50% product discount, complimentary and discounted services, including injectables, etc.)
* Wellness programs (Employee Assistance Program and discounted gym memberships)
* Discounted wireless phone services through Verizon.
* Discounts through PLUM and Work Advantage

  



**RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:**


* Review EOBs for accurate contract/non contracted payments and work on all correspondence daily to arrive at appropriate claim resolutions.
* Prepare and send written appeals with appropriate documentation.
* Complete refund request letters and attach appropriate documentation.
* Prepare write off requests accurately and attach appropriate documentation.
* Update patient demographics and insurance when necessary

  



**EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:**


* College Preferred
* Certified Professional Coder (CPC) Certification Preferred

  



**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:**


* 3+ years of medical insurance collections experience
* Working knowledge of CPT & ICD10 Coding
* Experience in working all insurance denials.

  


**Compensation: $23.00-$26.00**

  


**ABOUT US:**



New York Plastic Surgical Group, a division of Long Island Plastic Surgical Group, is the largest, longest-running academic plastic surgery group in the nation. Established in 1948, our practice has treated over half a million patients and developed many of the region's specialty centers including microsurgery, burn surgery, wound care, facial reanimation, peripheral nerve reconstruction, and cleft care. With 20+ surgeons and 10+ locations, we are proud to provide patients with over 75 years of medical innovation.



In addition to offering a full spectrum of plastic surgery and injectable services to our patients, we are also committed to supporting our community by meeting the need for reconstructive care. Each year our practice hosts an annual Breast Cancer Summit to provide an overview of the latest developments in breast cancer care and reconstruction.



Beyond our work locally we are also proud to partner with ReSurge International to bring our expertise in limb reattachment, complex wound and burn management, reconstructive cleft lip and palate repair, and other life-altering surgeries to underserved communities worldwide.



When it comes to aesthetics, our surgeons are proud to oversee Deep Blue Med Spa, a comprehensive medical spa designed to provide patients with non-surgical aesthetic options clinically proven to rejuvenate, restore, and refresh. From relaxing and results-driven facials to laser treatments and skin tightening, our highly skilled physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and medical aestheticians offer services customized to meet the needs of every patient. We also offer several medical-grade skincare brands including our signature line: ProBLUEMD®.

#### **Experience**


Required* 1 - 3 years: Medical Accounts Receivable/Collections


Preferred* 1 - 2 years: Surgical Collections

#### **Education**


Preferred* Bachelors or better in Accounting or related field
company_addresses: Located in Garden City, Babylon, East Hills, Huntington, Brooklyn, Flushing and NYC.
company_description: New York Plastic Surgical Group is dedicated to providing compassionate and comprehensive care to its patients through the collective medical expertise of its surgeons.

title: Dispatch Coordinator
description:
**Job Summary:**

The Dispatch Coordinator is responsible for overseeing the distribution of printed materials from the production facility to clients and distribution centers. This role ensures timely and accurate delivery, manages shipping logistics, and coordinates with other departments to meet customer expectations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Dispatch Operations:**

○ Plan and coordinate the daily dispatch schedule to ensure timely delivery of printed products.

○ Verify and prepare shipping documentation, including bills of lading, packing slips, and delivery notes.

○ Monitor and track shipments to ensure they are dispatched and delivered on schedule.

**2. Inventory Management:**

○ Manage and track inventory of packaging materials and dispatch supplies.

○ Ensure that items are properly packed and labeled according to customer specifications.

**3. Communication:**

○ Liaise with production, sales, and customer service teams to ensure smooth handover of orders for dispatch.

○ Communicate with shipping carriers and resolve any issues related to delivery or transportation.

**4. Customer Service:**

○ Address and resolve customer inquiries and complaints related to dispatch and delivery.

○ Provide updates to clients on the status of their orders and address any delivery issues promptly.

**5. Documentation and Reporting:**

○ Maintain accurate records of dispatched orders, shipping costs, and delivery confirmations.

○ Prepare and submit regular reports on dispatch performance and any issues encountered

**6\\*.** Compliance and Safety:\\*

○ Ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations related to shipping and handling.

○ Adhere to safety protocols in the handling and dispatch of printed materials.

**Qualifications:**

● Additional certification in logistics or supply chain management is a plus.

● Proven experience in dispatch or logistics, preferably within the print or manufacturing industry.

● Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

● Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

● Proficiency in computer applications and dispatch software.

● Attention to detail and accuracy in handling documentation and shipments.

**Physical Requirements:**

● Ability to lift and move packages of varying sizes and weights.

● Capability to stand, walk, and perform manual tasks for extended periods.

**Work Environment:**

● Fast-paced warehouse or production environment.

● May require occasional overtime or weekend work depending on business needs.

**Job Hours:** **12:00 pm - 8:30 pm.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $24.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant General Manager (AGM)
description:
**Key Objective(s):**

The main purpose of the Assistant General Manager is:

* Supports the General Manager in overseeing the daily operations, strategic planning, and development of educational programs. This role involves assisting with staff management, ensuring compliance with educational standards, and fostering a productive and inclusive learning environment.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

1. **Operational support:**

* Assist in managing daily operations to ensure smooth functioning of all activities.
* Ensure compliance with safety regulations and educational guidelines.
* Oversee payroll functions for team members ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
* Assist with the Implementation and management of expense and labor budgets.

2. **Staff Coordination:**

* Support the hiring, training, and supervision of teaching and administrative staff.
* Assist in conducting performance evaluations and providing professional development opportunities.
* Monitor the execution of all training programs for current and new employees ensuring a well-trained, motivated staff.

3. **Program Assistance:**

* Help design and implement curriculum and experiential learning programs.
* Assist in organizing and scheduling educational activities and events.

4. **Community Engagement:**

* Help build and maintain relationships with parents, students, and community partners.

5. **Problem Solving:**

* Address and resolve issues or conflicts that arise within the center.

6. **Assessment and Reporting:**

* Assist in monitoring and reporting on the progress and performance of the center’s programs.
* Use data to help make informed decisions and improvements.
* Ensure compliance of supervisors and team leaders with company policies and procedures.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Education, Management, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
* 3+ years of experience in educational management or a similar role.
* Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
* Experience in budget management and strategic planning.
* Passion for education and creating impactful learning experiences.

title: Personal Banker - Regional
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Responsible for providing exceptional customer service in accordance with Valley's mission statement. Ability to engage customers with friendly and professional service.
* Knowledge of all Bank products and services and ability to educate and demonstrate customers on such, as well as cross sell various products and services.
* Ability to present a confident and professional demeanor to establish trust and gain knowledge from the customer. Analyze needs and recommend appropriate products and services.
* At the direction of the District Operations Manager, must have the ability to travel to various branch locations to provide coverage which will continue to ensure high levels of customer service within the branch network.
* Meets with customers to analyze financial needs and maximize sales opportunities. Offers all bank products and assists with other service needs, opens new accounts, i.e. checking, savings, certificate of deposit and IRAs, discusses/sells loan products to existing and prospective customers and possesses knowledge of on-line banking and mobile banking abilities to promote and demonstrate to customers.
* Responsible for meeting customer expectations and achieving service quality standards. Participates/oversees the sales referral process ensuring customer financial needs are met and assists management in coaching and mentoring branch staff members.
* Ability to perform all transactions required by a customer and use appropriate technology to provide services most effectively and efficiently. Maintain and balance a cash box. Ability to utilize technology such as Teller Scanning Equipment, Cash Recycling and Cash Dispensing machines and support customers in the use of Coin Machines.
* Act as Vault Teller ensuring adequacy of Branch cash for daily transactions by assisting the branch staff in ordering and shipping currency & coin and controlling & distributing cash to Tellers in prescribed limits.
* Report all significant matters, issues and unusual customer activity to Manager maintaining personal knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Maintains knowledge and compliance with the Bank's Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:**
* Excellent verbal and written communication. Ability to write correspondence and appropriately and accurately demonstrate products and services to customers.
* Excellent interpersonal & customer service skills, attentiveness, information retention, tact and diplomacy in dealing with both customers and employees.
* Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills to effectively uncover and resolve complex customer issues.
* Ability to adapt to different staff and customers daily due to continuously varying branches, while performing the same functions and providing the same level of service.
* Ability to make sound decisions which include on-the-spot decisions regarding customer transactions; weighing customer satisfaction issues with the Bank exposure to loss or fraud and the ability to think through and rationalize decisions.
* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or scheduled form.
* Provides deep understanding of Retail Banking and strong Customer Service Skills with the ability to engage customers in conversation regarding products and services.
* Detail oriented, strong organizational skills, and high degree of accuracy.
* Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Proficient computer skills.

**Required Experience:**
* High School Diploma or GED and 1 year of business services experience in branch banking and knowledge of branch operations or successful completion of a Valley Retail training program.
* Associates or Bachelor's degree with concentration in accounting, business, finance, economics or a related field is preferred.
* FIS/IBS (Integrated Banking Solutions) preferred.
company_description: If you think working in banking can’t be exciting, think again. The financial industry is undergoing a digital transformation, which makes this a great time to embark on a career at Valley.

title: Maintenance Technician - 2nd Shift
description:
Starting Pay: $25.00 / hour or more, depending on experience

Shift: 2nd  



This is a full-time position within our manufacturing facility with opportunities for advancement!

  


**Who we are!**  

Schwan's Company, a U.S. affiliate of the global lifestyle company CJ CheilJedang Corporation, is a leading U.S. manufacturer and marketer of quality foods offered through retail-grocery and food-service channels. Its many popular brands include Red Baron®, Tony's®, Big Daddy's™, Villa Prima®, and Freschetta® pizza; Mrs. Smith's® and Edwards® desserts; Bibigo®, and Pagoda® Asian-style snacks. To learn more about Schwan's, visit www.schwanscompany.com.
**What we want to do for you:**  

We offer eligible employees competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package designed to assist employees and their families with their financial security, health, and well-being.


* Health, Life, Dental, and Vision Plans
* Earn up to 2 weeks paid time off during first year
* 401k with Company Match


**What we are looking for:**



Here at Schwan’s Company, we put a high priority on having safe, clean, and healthy workspaces. And we want individuals that take that seriously.


* High School Diploma or equivalent required. Two-year degree in specialized maintenance trade preferred.
* 0-2 years of related experience
* Basic mechanical knowledge required and electrical skills preferred
* Ability to read and interpret safety documents, maintenance instructions and procedure manuals
* Ability to complete work orders and enter the required paperwork into a computer
* Ability to add subtract multiply and divide in all units of measure
* Demonstrated interpersonal skills to communicate in a professional manner with co-workers and supervisors
* Must be able to lift up to ninety (90) lbs


**Responsibilities:**


* Ensure operation of machinery and mechanical equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements on conveyor systems and production machines; troubleshoot malfunctions
* Setup and tear down equipment; may assist with major repairs, construction, fabrication, and installation of new plant equipment
* Locate sources of problems by observing mechanical devices in operation, listening for problems, and using precision measuring and testing instruments
* Remove defective parts by dismantling components using hoists and hand and power tools
* Help control downtime by informing production workers of routine preventive maintenance techniques; monitoring compliance
* Use SAP to document and communicate with operations
* Work in a safe manner with a sense of urgency while maintaining a safe and orderly work area
* Participate in and successfully complete management-assigned training directed at increasing job-related trade skills
* The use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is required, including but not limited to bump cap, safety glasses/goggles, ear plugs, hair and beard nets, gloves and safety shoes or rubber boots
* Conducting yourself in a manner consistent with company mission, values, code of ethics, policies, and other standards of conduct

  

Here at Schwan's Company, we put a high priority on having safe, clean, and healthy workspaces. And we want individuals that take that seriously.



The employing subsidiaries of Schwan's Company are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, age, race, color, religion, gender, vet status, national origin, or other protected class.

This is a full-time position within our manufacturing facility with opportunities for advancement!

  


**Who we are!**  

Schwan's Company, a U.S. affiliate of the global lifestyle company CJ CheilJedang Corporation, is a leading U.S. manufacturer and marketer of quality foods offered through retail-grocery and food-service channels. Its many popular brands include Red Baron®, Tony's®, Big Daddy's™, Villa Prima®, and Freschetta® pizza; Mrs. Smith's® and Edwards® desserts; Bibigo®, and Pagoda® Asian-style snacks. To learn more about Schwan's, visit www.schwanscompany.com.  

**What we want to do for you:**  

We offer eligible employees competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package designed to assist employees and their families with their financial security, health, and well-being.
* Health, Life, Dental, and Vision Plans
* Earn up to 2 weeks paid time off during first year
* 401k with Company Match


**What we need from you:**


* Associates degree or equivalent experience and 1 - 5 years of related experience
* Basic electrical skills required, Arc Flash trained, must understand solid state circuitry, must understand 110V, 220V, 440V, and 480V systems
* Must be able to lift ninety (90) lbs.
* Ability to read electrical schematics, diagnose problems with programmable controllers on equipment, and operate electrical testing equipment and machining equipment
* Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
* Ability to complete work orders, carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form and complete required paperwork
* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, divide in all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals and calculate figures and amounts such as proportions, percentages, area circumference, and volume
* Ability to expand knowledge and skills via on-the-job and formal training directed at increasing job-related skills as mandated by management/Supervisor including all required OSHA training
* Ability to learn basic computer skills including SAP Maintenance Module.
* Ability to comply with all general safety policies and procedures in accordance with Company, Local, State, and Federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) rules and regulations
* Ability to obtain a valid forklift license


**Responsibilities:**
* Responsible for electrical troubleshooting, installation, preventative maintenance, and repair of assigned production machinery, mechanical equipment, and/or property to ensure continuous and effective operation
* Perform simple to standard repairs and assist in receiving, adjusting, and installing new plant equipment insuring the proper electrical performance; operating a variety of power hand and shop tools as required
* Assist in the diagnosis of electrical, mechanical, plumbing, and similar problems and apply appropriate corrective action
* Read and interprets schematic drawings and diagrams required to perform maintenance on or install plant equipment
* May assist with major repairs and/or construction required to plant buildings and equipment primarily electrical in nature
* Perform preventative electrical repairs on electrical cords and motors and assist with preventative maintenance on equipment replacement of parts
* Run conduit and pulls, electrical wire to wire new and used equipment, and help replace starters, relays switches, and fuses in electrical panels. Help replace main and auxiliary disconnects as required
* Perform basic electrical duties including but not limited to: using a voltage/ohm meter to check motor windings, fuses, line voltage output, and transformer output using an amp meter to amp a motor, using motor leads to reverse a motor, using an electrical schematic to determine machine line voltage, fuse sizing and transformer incoming and outgoing voltages, and checking/troubleshooting single phase and three phase wiring
* Participate in and successfully complete training directed at increasing job-related trade skills as mandated by management/supervisor
* Help train Maintenance employees in keeping all equipment in good repair and regularly serviced and notify supervisor of electrical or related problems as required
* Perform all duties in accordance with USDA, company policy, and established procedures and maintains clean work area
* The use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is required; including but not limited to bump cap, safety glasses/goggles, ear plugs, hair and beard nets, gloves and safety shoes or rubber boots


The employing subsidiaries of The Schwan Food Company are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, age, race, color, religion, gender, vet status, national origin, or other protected class.

title: Dining Services Manager
description:
Unidine
**Position Title:** **Dining Services Manager - Old Bridge, NJ**

**Salary:** **$60000**

**Other Forms of Compensation:** Merit increases


**Location** - Skilled Nursing Facility in Old Bridge, NJ




Think Fresh! Lead with Excellence!


An industry leading hospitality food service group, Unidine is driven by its exceptional people sharing their passion, creativity and talent to craft memorable guest experiences. Unidine’s commitment to scratch cooking, innovative programs, venue concepts and services continues to push boundaries and modernize dining programs for hundreds of clients around the nation. Our restaurants, bars, cafeterias and bistros offer a place for guests to enjoy something extraordinary. That is why we believe that using the freshest ingredients makes for the best dishes, staying ahead of industry trends pushes us to be innovative, and giving team members the right tools and resources helps them to perform their best. Come and join our award-winning team!

**Job Summary**
---------------


**Summary:** As a Dining Services Manager, you will manage a team of food service professionals and be responsible for the overall service in the main dining room as well as special functions. Additionally, you will assist with maintaining interdepartmental relations and integrating the dining service department with the facility plan of operation.




**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Oversees dining services operations of a medium to large volume location.
* Interacts with customers and resolves customer complaints in a friendly and service-oriented manner.
* Assists with profit and loss and budgeting as it pertains to this account.
* Works with the Chef and management team in creating menus and providing top quality food.
* Assists in the responsibility for all food service-related activities and be primarily involved in meal services in a seated dining room setting, including quality improvement, sanitation, infection control and all facility-related activities.
* Assists with the rollout of new culinary programs in conjunction with the marketing and culinary team.
* Assists with the preparation of quarterly reports for client presentation.
* Works with marketing and culinary department to increase sales by innovations and food quality.
* Communicates with the culinary department to ensure the food programs reflect the vision of the company.
* Performs other duties as assigned.




**Qualifications:**

* 2 years of food service management experience.
* Experience in restaurants, hotels, corporate dining, education, military, health care, and/or related food service operations.
* Waited table and catering experience is preferred.
* Some knowledge of food and catering trends with a focus on quality, production, sanitation, food cost controls, and presentation.
* Communication skills both written and verbal.
* Financial, budgetary, accounting and computational skills.
* Proficient computer skills and knowledge of MS Office products, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and internet.
* ServSafe Certification is preferred.
* Associate’s degree is preferred.

title: Associate Vice President of Pathways to Wellness-HH530102
description:
Under the supervision of the SVP, Treatment, and Recovery Services Division, the AVP of Pathways to Wellness provides clinical, administrative, and financial oversight to the Child Intensive Case Management Program, non-Medicaid Adult Blended Case Management Program, Health Home Plus, Adult Home Plus, care management program downstream from lead Health Homes, and all other care coordination programs. The AVP is responsible for establishing programmatic goals, monitoring and managing personnel, meeting quality assurance and outcome measures, and ensuring operational and financial compliance with local, State, and other rules, regulations, and guidelines.


**ESSENTIAL TASKS:**


*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty listed satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions unless this causes undue hardship to the agency.*



1. Helps create targets for growth and implements and monitors adherence to plan for outreach and ground up referrals.



2. In collaboration with agency and lead health home quality assurance and compliance departments, implements and monitors systems related to clinical, operational, and billing compliance according to regulations, policies and procedures of lead health homes, and other relevant guidelines, and ensures documentation is appropriate.



3. Oversees hiring of staff and oversight of personnel. Ensures they are appropriately trained to provide clinical services within ICL’s philosophy of person centered, trauma informed, integrated, and outcomes driven care. Encourages the use of evidence-based practices in everyday care.



4. Collaborates with SVP and Finance Department to create and manage within budget. Oversees Program Administrator to manage reimbursement for services and maximizes reimbursement.



5. Participates in health home committees as required. Ensures ongoing understanding of all policies, procedures, requirements and changes.



6. Participates in agency committees as appropriate and positively represents ICL to external stakeholders.



7. Collaborates with Corporate Office to ensure all support services are adequately provided to program.



8. Performs other duties as required.


**ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:**



1. Knowledge of mental health and industry trends.



2. Ability to build teams, lead a multi-disciplinary staff of professionals and paraprofessionals in providing treatment services.



3. Ability to think strategically, analyze trends, identify problems, and provide and implement effective solutions.



4. Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines and manage resources which includes money, material, time, and people.



5. Serves as a role model to staff and members



6. Demonstrates knowledge of, and supports, organizational mission, vision, and values, and the code of ethical behavior.



7. Ability to navigate, collaborate, and be effective within dynamic, complex organization.


**JOB SPECIFICATIONS:**



Education: Licensed Psychologist or Licensed Social Worker (LCSW preferred) with current, valid NYS registration. A condition of continuing employment is that licensure is maintained.



Training and Experience: 5 years minimum clinical experience and 3 years minimum progressive administrative and/or supervisory experience preferred.



Job Knowledge: Must have a good understanding of state and city OMH, NYCDHMH regulations, and community-based programs, services, and resources. Superior written and verbal communication skills are a must. Must be comfortable with various software and technology necessary for performing duties. Successful track record of leading diverse interdisciplinary staff is essential.

title: 94347- Associate Counsel - Level B, Legal Affairs Claims & Litigation
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

**NYC Health + Hospitals** is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

**Summary of Duties and Responsibilities:**

Attorney will be assigned to the Claims and Litigation Division of the Office of Legal Affairs. The chosen candidate will be an integral part of a team of litigation associates who manage and handle a case load of complex medical malpractice claims filed against the largest municipal health care system in the country.  
**General tasks and responsibilities will include:**

General tasks and responsibilities will work under the supervision of the managing attorney and be expected to handle complex medical malpractice claims from inception through final resolution, including trials. Strong medical-legal analytical skills are required. This is a litigating position that will require handling a case load, developing defense strategies, recommending and working with medical experts, assessing potential exposure of claims, preparing treating physicians and other medical care providers for depositions and/or trial, and drafting substantive motions. Additional responsibilities of this position may include presenting cases to facilities and senior executives of the Hospital System and working with Risk Management on issues that have the potential for litigation.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. A baccalaureate degree or equivalent, and LLB or JD from an accredited School of Law; and admission to New York State Bar; and

2. Three (3) years of experience and background in the practice of law subsequent to admission to the Bar in matters of litigation, negligence, corporate law, contracts, real estate, labor relations, labor law and employee relations, or

3. Two (2) years of experience and background in the practice of law subsequent to admission to the Bar in matters of litigation, negligence, corporate law, contracts, real estate, labor relations, employment law and employee relations, with two (2) years of progressively responsible experience in a professional or managerial capacity in respective fields applicable to the general body of law, specialties or practice.

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $146,300.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Office Coordinator
description:
**Organization Profile**

Stupid Cancer is the world leader in adolescent and young adult cancer advocacy, research, support, and education. Founded in 2007, Stupid Cancer has spent more than a decade ending isolation, building community, providing education, redefining quality of life, and improving health outcomes for this community. We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented **Office Coordinator** with strong database management skills to join our team. This role is a hybrid position, balancing typical office management responsibilities with the management and maintenance of our organizational database. The ideal candidate will ensure smooth office operations, efficient record-keeping, and provide support to various departments through effective database utilization and oversight. You will serve as a key member of the team providing support and information across departments.

**Our Core Values**

1. We are an interconnected community, including EVERYONE affected by adolescent and young adult (AYA) cancer, where all experiences are honored, celebrated, and seen.

2. We believe that all people should receive equal access to quality, holistic cancer care no matter their diagnosis, location, means, age, race/ethnicity, ability, sexuality, or gender.

3. We empower our community with comprehensive resources and support.

4. We support the AYA community by addressing the real life hurdles that come with cancer as a young person and advocate for change where traditional support systems fall short.

5. We connect with our community with an honest, unapologetic voice.

6. Our programming is innovative and socially responsive.

Stupid Cancer recognizes the benefits of flexibility in a work schedule, but also the innovation that comes from working collaboratively in-person. Our current schedule is virtual three days a week and in-person at our NYC headquarters in Tribeca two days. The Office Coordinator will report directly to the CEO with responsibilities to the Director of Development and the Director of Programs.

**Position Description**

**Office Management:**

* Oversee the day-to-day administrative operations of the office, ensuring it runs efficiently and smoothly and maintain an organized office environment.
* Coordinate office logistics, including managing office supplies, maintaining office equipment, and some meeting scheduling.
* Assist Director of Finance in vendor invoicing and payment.
* Handle communication with vendors, service providers, and building management.
* Act as the point of contact for internal staff and external stakeholders regarding office-related inquiries.
* Oversee merchandise purchases and shipping.
* Other duties as required.

**Database Management:**

* Manage, update, and maintain internal organizational databases, ensuring data integrity and security.
* Create reports, queries, and data exports as required by various.
* Oversee all data import and ensure data quality.
* Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues in a timely manner.
* Ensure data entry and update processes are efficient, accurate, and performed consistently across teams.
* Provide training and support to staff on database systems and best practices.
* Collaborate with IT for any system upgrades, migrations, or database software maintenance.

**Qualifications**

* Four year college degree or equivalent experience
* Minimum of three years of operational experience
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of team
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Familiarity with Neon One Database and Neon Fundraise a plus
* Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship provided
* This position is located in New York City

**Salary and Benefits**

The salary range for this full-time, non-exempt position is $45,000 - $50,000 based on experience and credentials with full benefits and eligibility to participate in our 401K plan.

**To apply, please send cover letter and resume to HR@stupidcancer.org. Resumes without cover letters will not be considered.**

Pay: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance

* Professional development assistance

title: Counselor (Adolescent population)
description:
High Focus Centers in Lawrenceville is a premier provider of outpatient treatment programs for mental health, substance use and co-occurring disorders. Our highly trained staff create individualized, comprehensive and robust treatment plans designed to meet each client’s treatment goals. At High Focus Centers in Lawrenceville we are currently seeking a Adolescent Clinician to join our amazing team of behavioral healthcare professionals in facilitating individual therapy, group therapy and group based psycho-education . If after reading the job posting you feel you are qualified and interested in this role, we invite you to apply for this amazing opportunity!

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday 830a-530p

**Salary:** $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Evaluates behavioral, emotional, cognitive, spiritual, and social needs of clients in collaboration with and consideration of family members
* Facilitates all clinical services for clients including individual and family sessions, therapeutic groups, and referral source/ outpatient provider contact.
* Responsible for maintaining clinical record for clients with appropriate documentation of clinical services and client program engagement
* Participates in aftercare plan development and outcome data process.
* Will utilize Evidence based practice
