title: Organizational Effectiveness Consultant
description:
We act as a strategic partner with the business to maximize the value of Vonage's greatest asset – our people. We embrace change and the opportunity it brings, acting as a catalyst to enable all Vonage employees to develop and contribute to their optimum potential. We leverage industry best practices. Our team is focused and committed to recruiting, developing, rewarding and retaining our high-performing global workforce.


**Why this role matters**



Organization Effectiveness (within Human Resources) partners with business leaders to transform culture, build thriving teams and develop our talent. We assess capability requirements, identify gaps and develop learning solutions that accurately reflect individual, team and broader organizational needs. You can join our team as an Organization Effectiveness Consultant, providing learning, development and cultural transformation support across a variety of initiatives and programs and diverse audiences.


**IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU, CONTINUE READING BELOW…….**


**What you will do**


* Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts across functional teams to understand business objectives, talent/capability profiles and define developmental solutions
* Design, develop and deliver engaging and impactful learning experiences tailored to address skills growth goals, aligned to business strategy
* Ensure learning solutions influence positive change, align with strategic business objectives and enhance individual and organization capability.
* Facilitate learning and development as an instructor, designer, business partner and internal consultant.
* Manage programs in support of our cultural transformation and ways of working
* Manage your own projects; you will have experience in program management, leveraging continuous improvement methodologies such as Kaizen
* Use Design Thinking approaches to understand user requirements, challenge assumptions, redefine problems, and create innovative solutions to prototype and test
* Contribute to broader organization development efforts and support team projects to scale and expand availability of learning and development solutions.
* Evaluate success through insights derived from various data sources and formats
* Perpetually update materials and programs based on learner feedback.
* Remain aware of emerging instructional technologies and best practices, and make recommendations about when to adopt certain approaches to offer the best learning experience possible.
* As needed, assist with delivery and facilitation of live training programs (virtual and in-person)
* Provide support for our learning experience platform (LXP) to learners, stakeholders and administrators
* Provide Ad hoc creative support to CPO with special initiatives and projects.


**What you will bring**


* Demonstrated knowledge of human behavior, adult learning theory and other factors that impact effective learning and development outcomes.
* Experience in analyzing learning needs and developing appropriate solutions
* Experience in enterprise transformation projects
* Excellent verbal / written communication, facilitation and presentation skills.
* Experience with video editing, image editing, and rapid e-learning tools such as Articulate, Camtasia, Captivate, etc.
* Strong program Management skills
* Design Thinking experience
* Strong attention to detail and creative thinking.
* Ability to work as part of a collaborative team and on solo projects


**What is required for application**


* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Industrial / Organizational Psychology, Behavioral Sciences, Human Resources, Business or related discipline.
* Prior experience (early career) in a Learning & Development, Organizational Effectiveness, or related role.
* Prior experience (early career) with e-learning design and development, graphic design, or related experience, developing e-learning content in Articulate or similar tools.
* Working knowledge of modern Learning Management Systems (Thrive would be a big bonus)
* Program Management and Design Thinking experience

#### **What's in it for you:**



In addition to providing exciting work, career advancement opportunities, and a collaborative work environment, Vonage provides competitive pay and benefits including unlimited discretionary time off and tuition reimbursement.

  


*Note: The purpose of this profile is to provide a general summary of essential responsibilities for the position and is not meant as an exhaustive list. Assignments may differ for individuals within the same role based on business conditions, departmental need or geographic location.*

description:
The Rates Operations and Client Services team is the single point of contact/first level of escalation to members, clients and exchanges and has the ultimate responsibility of ensuring a positive experience at LCH in respect to the SwapClear, Listed Rates, and SwapAgent services. The Operations and Client Services team works closely with all internal and external stakeholders to ensure queries and issues are followed through to resolution. This is a highly visible role, working with sales and marketing as well as senior management.
The successfull candidate should possess 2+ years experience in clearing and related trade workflow. Examples include various life-cycle events across the services such as margin runs, compression offering and portfolio transfers.Working individually is just as important as within a team in this role, and the ability to work to tight timeframes and interact across geographical locations is required. A pro-active, confident and well-presented individual who possesses a greater level of aptitude for taking ownership of processes and is willing to progress as the team continues to grow will be a preferred candidate.
Essential Skills* Knowledge of central clearing and trade workflow is preferable.

* Strong analytical, numerical and problem solving skills, with good attention to detail.

Target AIP rates will be commensurate with role level and posted career stage. Individual salary will be reflective of job related knowledge, skills and equivalent experience. LSEG roles (excluding internships and part-time roles of less than 20 hours per week) are typically eligible for inclusion in our LSEG Benefits program, which includes offerings of: Annual Wellness Allowance, Paid time-off, Medical, Dental, Vision, Flex Spending & Health Savings Options, Prescription Drug plan, 401(K) Savings Plan and Company match. Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. description:
Safety Facility Services is in search of a friendly and professional security guards to manage all client services for our commercial and residential properties in the New York area. We’re searching for individuals who can provide high-quality service to all tenants and understands the worth of exceptional customer service.

As an on-call security guards, you can select to work a schedule that works for you. If you enjoy a flexible schedule and want to gain experience working in different luxurious residential and commercial buildings - or if you want to grow into the security/hospitality industry- this is the job for you!

Who You Are:

* You enjoy a flexible schedule.
* You adapt easily to different environments.
* You have a confident personality and enjoy interacting with others.
* You have excellent communication skills.
* You work well with other members of the building such as supers, porters, and building staff.
* You work well under little direct management.
* You are reliable, punctual, and have superb attendance.

Site Location:

* Midtown Manhattan

Requirements:

* Must have active NYS security guard license.

Description:

* Welcome all employees into the buildings.
* Maintain control of all keys. This includes logging the keys in and out.
* Announce all visitors to the clients and tenants. Keep all visitors at the front desk until permission is received from the unit resident/tenant.
* Log in and secure all packages, deliveries, and other appropriate items at the designated area.
* Ensure that all visitors to the building are properly greeted, identified, and documented.
* Uphold and enforce all agency rules, regulations, policies, and procedures.
* Answer facility phones in a professional manner; keep a record of all actively engaged in the building clearly and articulately in logbooks
* Maintain a clean and pleasant environment.
* Log in and secure all packages, deliveries, and other appropriate items at the designated area
* Assist with opening/closing of doors.
* Assist with upkeeping and cleaning on lobby areas or designated common areas.

**Company Overview**

Safety Facility Services is an industry-leading provider of comprehensive facility maintenance services for commercial and residential properties of all sizes. We utilize customized technology and specialized systems to support our team of trained professionals, helping us deliver exceptional services to our customers. Founded in 1992 and currently servicing over 10mm SQF with over 500 employees, our company has evolved to include specialists in commercial cleaning, engineering and operations, architectural maintenance (metal, marble and wood), pest control, security, and lighting and energy solutions. And we’re about being sustainable, for your budget and the environment. It’s why we’re the fastest growing team in the eastern US.

**OUR VALUES**  
Our company is comprised of a of a set of operating principles called "core values". They are “Mary Minds, One Mission; Everything with Integrity; Be Accountable; and Adapt & Grow. These core values serve as the foundation for who we are as a company, how we conduct business, interact with our customers and, last but certainly not least, each other. We have a grand vision to be the best at what we do while also "Building a Great Place to work".

**Diversity Statement:**  
Safety Facility Services is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant
description:
Multi-state law firm with offices in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Vermont, and Pennsylvania is seeking an Receptionist/Administrative Assistant to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with plenty of opportunities for growth and advancement.

Our firm represents mortgage servicers, banks and card issuers in all courts, both state and federal. We specialize in commercial and residential mortgage foreclosure, debt collection and post-judgment recovery, bankruptcy, creditors’ rights, evictions, loss mitigation, mediations, contested litigation, real estate and financial services litigation. We pride ourselves on our attention to detail, responsiveness and innovation when navigating the difficult regulatory environment in today’s mortgage servicing industry. Our firm is dedicated to providing our clients with superior legal services in a quick, efficient and cost-effective manner. We are recognized as one of the leading firms in our field by the largest loan servicers and card issuers in the nation.

Currently we are seeking an Receptionist/Administrative Assistant to join our team in our Armonk, NY office. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with ample opportunities for growth and advancement.

The ideal candidate is energetic, flexible, and professional and has experience with working in a law firm environment.

Responsibilities:

* Greet and welcome guests as soon as they arrive at the office
* Answer, screen and forward incoming phone calls
* Ensure reception area is tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and material (e.g. pens, envelopes, etc.)
* Receive, sort, scan and distribute daily mail/deliveries
* Update firm case management system
* Perform other clerical duties such as filing, photocopying, mailings and faxing

Education & Experience:

* Strong word processing and proofreading skills
* Ability to work meticulously to ensure the quality of your product

title: Data & Analytics Apprentice
description:
At Prosek Partners, the stories we tell impact the global economy.



Prosek's Apprentice Program offers post graduate students the opportunity to launch their careers in certain areas of interest. Our 6-month program is designed to train the next generation of agency professionals.



We are in search of a talented apprentice to join our fast-growing data & analytics (DNA) team at Prosek. We are looking for a self-starter interested in how data and insights guide storytelling and strategy, solve client challenges, and measure impact.



We are looking for a self-starter interested in how data and insights guide storytelling and strategy, solve client challenges, and measure impact.



Our team is made up of intellectually curious researchers, data analysts, writers, creatives, strategists, and counselors. We get to work with many of the largest and most recognizable global financial brands and help them navigate the always-evolving world of digital marketing and communications.



At Prosek, everyone is expected to be a strong team player, participating in brainstorming and creative strategy planning for clients and internal projects. Our culture is built around being an "Army of Entrepreneurs," and we encourage everyone to embrace that and be the "writer of their own story."



Sound interesting? We'd love to hear from you.

  


**Program Overview and Responsibilities**


***Real Work Experience***



Prosek Apprentices will:


*Administrative*

* Work alongside DNA team members and integrated internal Prosek account teams to support various data-related requests.
* Understand data sources and systems to ensure data integrity and accuracy.


*Data Analytics*


* Utilize social listening, media monitoring and measurement, and analytics tools: Talkwalker, Signal AI, Tagger, SEMrush, etc. for various analyses.
* Perform deep dive analyses on data from multiple sources to identify opportunities for clients, spot trends, and measure performance.


*Primary Research*


* Support in the execution of quantitative and qualitative research projects, including but not limited to, online surveys, focus groups, in-depth interviews, and online communities


*Reporting*


* Understand and assist with presenting results and data-driven narratives in focused, actionable and compelling ways.

  


***Internal Network and Support***



We invest heavily into the growth and support for our Prosek Apprentices, pairing each Apprentice with a manager and a mentor.


* Managers are responsible for identifying their Apprentice's strengths, areas for development and interests to ensure they're given the right tools to succeed.
* Mentors help provide support as they acclimate to a new environment and corporate culture.

  



The goal of Prosek's Development Program is to develop Apprentices into Assistant Account Executives by the end of the program.

  


**Experience and Qualifications**


* Completed BS/BA degree by the start of the program.
* A demonstrated interest in how data informs marketing communications strategy and results.
* Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.
* Curiosity and a desire to learn.
* Ability to conduct analysis and understand the value of measurement
* Strong knowledge of statistics principles and familiarity in using statistics in a real-world setting.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Possess a team player mindset and willingness to work collaboratively
* Have solid research and critical thinking skills along with strong time management and prioritization skills.
* Extreme attention to detail is a must.
* Strongly encouraged (but not required) to have prior data and analytics internship(s).

  



NYC Salary: $20.00/hour

  


*Prosek Partners provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Implementation Manager
description:
If you're into online shopping (who isn't these days?), chances are you've crossed paths with Yotpo. We're all about eCommerce retention—helping brands of every size turn one-time shoppers into lifelong customers.



Think loyalty programs, SMS and email marketing, subscriptions, and reviews—it's what we do best. Plus, we've got more tricks up our sleeve.



With teams spread across the globe—from the US and Canada to the UK, Israel, Bulgaria, and Australia—we're growing fast. Our main mission? Delivering cutting-edge technology that sets new standards in the industry.



Sounds exciting? Then read on, because we're looking for curious professional talents to be a part of building the future of the e-commerce industry.


As an **Implementation Manager**, you will be responsible for guiding customers through one or more of Yotpo's product setups, including: building initial program strategies or campaigns, integrations, training, testing, and project management.. Our customers vary in size and industry, so we are looking for motivated team members who have strong communication and project management skills, a passion for helping people, an interest in problem-solving with a solutions oriented mindset, and the flexibility to help with a variety of projects.


**You will:**


* Serve as the main point of contact for customers from deployment to launch to ensure a successful implementation process for Yotpo's products
* Ensure all customers complete the required technical setup efficiently and according to project plan and timeline
* Train and educate customers on how to effectively utilize Yotpo products via phone and videoconference
* Provide strategic guidance for how brands should set up their initial strategy/campaigns with Yotpo's products
* Improve and scale the Yotpo implementation process
* Act as liaison between customers and the Yotpo sales, product, support, professional services, and customer success teams to actively identify roadblocks and solutions during onboarding


**About you:**


* You're a great relationship manager and excel talking to VP- and C-suite leaders
* You can manage simultaneous software implementations for multiple clients
* You can research, troubleshoot and solve complex software issues
* You can effectively project manage and create organized plans that ensure customer success post-onboarding
* You can accurately synthesize client requests and questions, convey them to cross-functionally stakeholders, and work together to move implementations along
* Must have a valid U.S. work authorization to apply


**About Yotpo - US:**


* 100% coverage of employee medical premiums; 90% coverage for dependent/family premiums.
* 100% coverage of employee dental + vision premiums.
* Comprehensive life and disability insurance.
* Flexible Time Off (FTO) policy, sick time, and paid holidays.
* Equity in options.
* Company sponsored 401K matching.
* Pre-tax Commuter and Healthcare benefits.
* Comprehensive paid leave for new parents and Dependent Care FSA.
* Individualized career development, rewards and recognition.
* Wellness and philanthropic programming and events.
* We are working in a hybrid capacity, spending 3 days per week in our NYC office.
* Meet the team: Ally Zeltt, Karis Reiter, Isabella Quinones, Anthony Henkel, Lindsey Gerson


Yotpo's employee-centric culture has consistently earned us coveted spots on Built In's **Best Places to Work** lists in both NYC and Austin and Mogul's Companies with Most Inclusive Benefits over the years. Directly inspired by employee feedback, we create opportunities to bring our teams together. Yotpo programming includes team events, educational fireside chats, end of year celebrations, affinity groups and partnerships.


**Yotpo is for everyone, and we're committed to anti-racist work.** We welcome and employ people regardless of race, color, gender identity, religion, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where your voice is heard and your perspective is encouraged. Come join us and help us build a global company where we're all proud to belong.

  


Base Salary $80,000 - $85,000 – In addition to base salary, this role includes a variable compensation component.



Base salary ranges are determined by multiple factors unique to each candidate, including skills and local market benchmarks.

description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a full-time Patient Representative/Front Desk Receptionist to join our team at The Hub site in the Bronx, NY.


A Patient Representative/Front Desk Receptionist is responsible for providing patient centered care and facilitating patient access to services in a pleasant, knowledgeable efficient manner, communicating with a diverse population using well-developed interpersonal skills. This staff member will be responsible for all aspects of the registration and appointment process for patients. The staff member plays an integral role in the medical care team as the access point for patients to receive care. She/he will perform job duties in compliance with systems and job specific standards.

* Assist with daily reception activities and ensure that all processes needed for patient services are initiated.

* Responsible for the scheduling of appointments, fee collection, explanation of services and charges for patient services.
* Distributes materials to patients, including the patient satisfaction cards, patient rights and other appropriate materials.
* Verifies all insurance and sets fees based on the sliding scale fee.

title: Customer Service/Data Entry
description:
Job Overview

The Data Entry/Customer Service is responsible for managing the intake process for patients requiring durable medical equipment. This role includes collecting patient information, verifying insurance coverage, entering prescription details into the system, coordinating deliveries and installations, and providing excellent customer service. The DME Intake Specialist ensures compliance with all relevant regulations and maintains accurate records to facilitate smooth and efficient operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Patient Information Collection

2. Prescription Confirmation

3. Data Entry:

* Enter patient information into the Prime RX system.
* Create new patient profiles if necessary and ensure all information is accurate and up-to-date.
* Type prescription details, including prescriber NPI, DME items, dosage, and instructions.

4. Document Management:

* Scan and upload all relevant documents, such as prescriptions and insurance cards, into the Prime RX system.
* Update follow-up tags and add notes for additional information needed.

5. Clinical Request Preparation:

* Extract prescriber’s office information and complete clinical request forms.
* Print and fill out clinical request forms, marking required documents.

6. Delivery and Installation Coordination:

* Schedule deliveries and installations with technicians for items requiring setup, such as beds and wheelchairs.
* Coordinate cost-effective shipping for other items through relationships with services like Druglift and wholesalers.

7. Billing Preparation:

* Gather signed delivery tickets from patients upon receipt of their orders.
* Scan and attach signed delivery tickets to orders for billing purposes.

8. Customer Service:

* Respond to customer inquiries via phone and email regarding order status, product information, billing, and general concerns.
* Measure patients for custom garments and ensure accurate documentation.

**Required Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in healthcare or customer service is a plus.
* Experience in a healthcare or pharmacy setting, particularly with DME, is preferred.
* Strong computer skills, including proficiency with data entry and familiarity with pharmacy software (e.g., Prime RX).
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Attention to detail and strong organizational abilities.
* Ability to multitask and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and other healthcare compliance standards.

**Working Conditions:**

* This position may require standing for extended periods while measuring patients
* The DME Intake Specialist will work in a healthcare setting, with regular interaction with patients, healthcare providers, and technicians.
* Regular use of computers, scanners, and other office equipment.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to lift and move equipment as necessary.
* Manual dexterity for measuring, data entry, and handling documents.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $19.00 - $28.00 per hour

Benefits:

title: Kids Birthday Party Host (Party Pro)
description:
At Holiday Bowl, our Party Hosts take the reigns to ensure the Guest of Honor and their attendees are safe and have a blast and also to take care of any needs of the party that may arise as a dedicated VIP event host and communicate them to the Party Leader. Party Hosts must be outgoing, personable and able to communicate and be around large groups of children and their parents! Prior experience working with younger children, such as a daycare/camp counselors, and/or hospitality/customer service is a plus!

Each party lasts approximate 2-3 hours from set up to clean up depending on the party package reserved for. The party host is also responsible for setting up the party room and lanes for their incoming party, and help clean and transition party room for the next party at the end of their party. Hours are per diem (as needed) and are generally usually either Friday afternoon/evenings, Saturdays and Sundays (usually during the day/early evening) when children's parties are scheduled the most. The host is dedicated to be with their party for the duration of the event and make sure that the guests needs are taken care of, and the kids are playing safely and having a blast! Taking kids food order, Serving food, scooping ice cream, refilling fountain drinks, leading "happy birthday" festivities, cutting/serving cake or other dessert and other event host related activities are required. All training is provided.

This is an excellent role for outgoing high school or college students, camp counselors and/or teacher (or the like) candidates with a flexible schedule with part time/per-diem weekend work availability! Apply today or message us for more information about becoming a Party Pro at Holiday Bowl!

PAY: $5.50 per hour Server Wage plus TIPS earned on party (minimum earnings range approximately $20+ per hour or more)

WE OFFER A FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE BUT MUST BE AVAILABLE ON WEEKENDS FOR 1-2 PARTIES AS NEEDED MINIMUM. SCHEDULES ARE POSTED 1-2 WEEKS IN ADVANCE

Click Apply if you have what it takes to be a Party Pro!

title: Facilities Laborer
description:
**Company Description** **About Veolia North America**


A subsidiary of Veolia Group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water, and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education, and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has approximately 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com.

 **Job Description** **Pay Rate:** $20.65 to $27.60 per hour.

**BENEFITS**


Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

**Position Purpose:**


The employee is responsible for the maintenance and repair of buildings and grounds. The employee will possess a basic knowledge of electrical and all hazards.

**Primary Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Assist the skilled trade’s employees in performing operations and maintenance on plant equipment and buildings. Perform preventive maintenance functions, including, but not limited to lubrication of equipment. Disassemble and repack pumps.
* Perform custodial and clean-up work on plant grounds including cutting grass, snow removal and trash pick-up. Perform custodial work in buildings including, but not limited to, sweeping, mopping, waxing, buffing, washing windows scrubbing walls and vacuuming.
* Perform manual labor functions as assigned.
* Perform minor maintenance services on vehicles and equipment including, but not limited to, washing, tightening chains, replacing cables and bolts, checking tire inflation and performing lubrication according to the manufacturers’ recommended schedules.
* Perform regular checks of equipment condition, noting deficiencies and following maintenance scheduling procedures, schedule the necessary maintenance or replacement.
* Clean and prepare surfaces to be painted. Apply paint and varnish to buildings and equipment. Perform sign lettering skills as assigned.
* Recommend materials and supplies needed both to advise management on specific applications and to maintain inventory.
* Provide coverage for Bio-Solids Loader in the event of Staffing issues.
* Observe all on-the-job safety regulations.
* Other related tasks as assigned.

**Work Environment:**

* Work is performed both inside and outside with exposure to all kinds of weather conditions.
* Employee may be occasionally exposed to some noise, silica, dust, fumes, smoke, gases, grease, oils, electrical energy, solvents and vibration.
* Employee may work on slippery/uneven surfaces, around machinery with moving parts, moving objects/vehicles, ladder/scaffolding, below ground and may be exposed to water or other liquid materials.
* Maintain a high level of focus on health, safety and environment, ensuring safety within all activities.

  

**Qualifications** **Education/Experience/Background:**

* High School Diploma/GED is required.
* At least one (1) year of related experience.

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:**

* Able to utilize materials, methods, tools and equipment used in the day-to-day maintenance of buildings and grounds.
* Ability to adhere to all policies and regulations regarding safety.
* Ability to communicate written and orally.
* Knowledge or/and ability to safely operate all hand or power tools equipment related to the job
* Must be familiar with all safety regulations and be prepared to work in and supervise confined space entry, and LOTO procedures (Training provided)
* Ability to manipulate and understand the required functions of the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS)
* Vehicle and Heavy Equipment Operations:
	+ Pickup Truck(s)
	+ Forklift or other Powered Industrial Truck
	+ Cranes – Mobile and Truck Crane

**Required Certification/Licenses/Training:**

* Minimum two (2) year on job site training.
* Hold and maintain a NYS driver’s license - Commercial Driver’s License Preferred and the ability to meet risk management guidelines.

  

**Additional Information**  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.


Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.

title: Construction Superintendent
description:
**Exciting Career Opportunity!**

**Position**: Construction Superintendent  
**Location**: Manhattan, NY  
**Salary**: Up to $145,000 annually

Are you a skilled Construction Superintendent with a passion for managing large-scale commercial projects? We are looking for a dedicated individual to join our dynamic team and take the lead on high-profile construction initiatives throughout New York City.

**Role Overview**:

As a Construction Superintendent, you will manage all stages of our commercial construction projects, from the initial planning phase to final delivery. Your leadership and organizational skills will ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

**Key Duties**:

* Oversee daily site operations and manage construction activities from start to finish.
* Coordinate project meetings, ensuring effective communication between all parties.
* Create and maintain detailed project timelines and budget reports.
* Perform regular site visits to ensure compliance with design plans, safety regulations, and quality control standards.
* Collaborate with clients, subcontractors, and team members to guarantee successful project outcomes.
* Identify and resolve any issues or delays, keeping the project on track.
* Provide consistent updates on project milestones and performance.
* Conduct post-completion reviews to gather feedback and implement improvements for future projects.

**Perks & Benefits**:

We offer a robust benefits package, including:

* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage.
* Access to additional supplemental insurance options.
* Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability insurance.
* 401K retirement plan with a 3% company match.
* Generous paid time off, including holidays, vacation days, and sick leave.

This is a fantastic chance for an enthusiastic Construction Superintendent to take on exciting new challenges in New York’s commercial construction sector. If you’re ready to grow your career and deliver top-tier projects, we’d love to hear from you!

**Apply today** and be a key part of our success story!

title: Concierge (Mid-shift Full Time)
description:
Safety Facility Services is in search of a friendly and professional security guards to manage all client services for our commercial and residential properties in the New York area. We’re searching for individuals who can provide high-quality service to all tenants and understands the worth of exceptional customer service.

Who You Are:

* You enjoy a concierge role and have security experience.
* You adapt easily to different environments.
* You have a confident personality and enjoy interacting with others.
* You have excellent communication skills.
* You work well with other members of the building such as supers, porters, and building staff.
* You work well under little direct management.
* You are reliable, punctual, and have superb attendance.

What We Offer (full-time):

* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Paid Sick Time Off
* Commuter Program
* Employee Referral Program
* 401k

Schedule: Friday - Tuesday, 11:00am - 7:00pm

Pay Rate:

* $23.00/hr (Weekly pay, overtime pay rate when applicable)

Site Location:

* Lower Manhattan, 10003

Requirements:

* Must have active NYS security guard license.
* Concierge experience

Description:

* Welcome all employees into the buildings.
* Maintain control of all keys. This includes logging the keys in and out.
* Announce all visitors to the clients and tenants. Keep all visitors at the front desk until permission is received from the unit resident/tenant.
* Log in and secure all packages, deliveries, and other appropriate items at the designated area.
* Ensure that all visitors to the building are properly greeted, identified, and documented.
* Uphold and enforce all agency rules, regulations, policies, and procedures.
* Answer facility phones in a professional manner; keep a record of all actively engaged in the building clearly and articulately in logbooks
* Maintain a clean and pleasant environment.
* Log in and secure all packages, deliveries, and other appropriate items at the designated area
* Assist with opening/closing of doors.
* Assist with upkeeping and cleaning on lobby areas or designated common areas.

**Company Overview**

Safety Facility Services is an industry-leading provider of comprehensive facility maintenance services for commercial and residential properties of all sizes. We utilize customized technology and specialized systems to support our team of trained professionals, helping us deliver exceptional services to our customers. Founded in 1992 and currently servicing over 10mm SQF with over 500 employees, our company has evolved to include specialists in commercial cleaning, engineering and operations, architectural maintenance (metal, marble and wood), pest control, security, and lighting and energy solutions. And we’re about being sustainable, for your budget and the environment. It’s why we’re the fastest growing team in the eastern US.

**OUR VALUES**  
Our company is comprised of a of a set of operating principles called "core values". They are “Mary Minds, One Mission; Everything with Integrity; Be Accountable; and Adapt & Grow. These core values serve as the foundation for who we are as a company, how we conduct business, interact with our customers and, last but certainly not least, each other. We have a grand vision to be the best at what we do while also "Building a Great Place to work".

**Diversity Statement:**  
Safety Facility Services is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

**EEO Statement:** We are an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the company to hire, train, promote and pay its associates without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation or veteran status.

Disclaimer: The above statement are intendant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent (s) of the job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Job Type: Full-time

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Paid time off
* Referral program

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Principal Account Manager, Landmark
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 8 years of experience in digital media sales, digital advertising, or digital marketing, or 6 years of experience with an advanced degree.
* Experience working with advertisers, agencies, or clients.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience managing digital marketing/advertising campaigns, and managing relationships with clients, customers, or agencies.
* Experience with Google Ads, Display and Video 360, Search Ads 360, or similar digital advertising campaigns and platforms.
* Experience working with data to identify trends and performance insights.
* Experience in project management.
* Experience working in a complex, matrixed organization.
* Effective organizational, analytical and influencing skills.

**About the job**
-----------------


Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.



In this role, you will play a key role in driving our partner's growth through acquisition-focused marketing, full-funnel measurement, and video creative experimentation. This role allows you to establish senior stakeholder relationships and be instrumental in steering business outcomes for a company that values transformative ideas and expert execution.  

  



Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $114,000-$169,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Build and manage relationships with clients, and develop an understanding of their business challenges, marketing objectives, and success metrics.
* Work proactively and cooperatively with internal and external stakeholders to ensure workflows and projects are completed on time to a standard.
* Plan for, and achieve, business growth targets, through the presentation of Google advertising products/solutions that will help clients to meet their marketing objectives.
* Develop forward thinking, data-driven analyses and consultative recommendations that align with customer goals, and quantify high-impact opportunities with clear recommendations to present to customers.
* Build an in-depth knowledge of how Google Advertising products work and can be used to help meet a wide range of marketing objectives.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Transfer Agent
description:
**Job Description**

Management has been setting the standard in residential management since cooperative apartments were first introduced to New York City. We provide full-service residential management, with highly qualified personnel at every level ready to deliver unrivalled service, with honesty, discretion, and integrity. Today our management portfolio of more than 165 cooperatives and condominiums, with over 10,000 units, includes many of Manhattan’s most distinguished buildings.

The Transfer Agent facilitates the processing of purchase, rental and refinance applications for both co-op and condo buildings from start to finish. The Transfer Agent also serves as the primary point of contact for all deal parties as well as Board Members and Management throughout the application process leading up to, and including, the closing.

**Responsibilities**

* Communication with all levels of management as well as Board Members, attorneys, and brokers.
* Review of Applications for completion and accuracy.
* Correspond with brokers and deal parties to ensure submission of a complete application.
* Manage the approval of purchase and refinance applications, including administrative support.
* Coordinate interviews with perspective purchasers/tenants and Board of Managers/Directors
* Prepare documents required for closing and collect fees due to the Corporation/Condominium and the Managing Agent.
* Conduct closings for the applications assigned.
* Must have extensive knowledge of Real Estate closing procedures, New York City Laws, loans, mortgage financing, and Cooperatives/ Condominiums rules and procedures.
* Respond to daily email and voice mail messages.
* Address concerns of residents and coordinate with the management team where needed.

**Requirements**

* Must be knowledgeable in Boardpackager.
* Efficient communication skills
* Ability to multi-task and work under tight deadlines
* Familiarity with Co-op/Condo sales, leases, refinance trusts and non-sale transfers.
* High School diploma required.
* College Degree preferred.
* Notary required.

title: Physician Assistant (PA) or Nurse Practitioner (NP) - Emergency Department
description:
In the Emergency Department at Greenwich Hospital we are committed to providing high-quality patient-centered care. We care for over 42,000 patients a year primarily from Connecticut and lower Westchester County.

Greenwich Hospital is a preferred healthcare organization because of its high level of dedication in upholding a culture of safety. Our Emergency Department team is made up of highly qualified and skillful individuals consisting of Board-Certified Emergency Medicine Physicians, Advanced Practice Providers, RN’s, and nursing technicians. We are committed to optimizing the patient experience. We are a level 3 trauma center, a certified stroke center, and can provide primary angioplasty 24/7 for patients suffering from a heart attack.

Advanced Practice Providers play a critical patient care role in the Emergency Department.

We are looking for dynamic individuals, committed to clinical excellence, to join our team

**Why YNHHS?**

* **Dynamic Practice Settings:** Work across various settings, from inpatient to outpatient, as part of a multidisciplinary team.
* **Patient-Centered Approach:** Focus on the physical, psychosocial, spiritual, and functional needs of patients and their families.
* **Continuity of Care:** Serve as a pivotal professional ensuring seamless patient care within scope of practice and specialty standards.
* **Equal Opportunity Employer:** We are committed to diversity and welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds.

**Position Details:**

* A minimum of one year of direct patient care experience within an Emergency Dept/Urgent Care required.
* Part time - 12 Hour, Rotating shift

**Your Responsibilities:**

**Clinical Care**

* Assess, triage, and manage patient/family needs throughout the disease process.
* Collaborate with attending physicians to develop and implement treatment plans.
* Perform physical examinations, order diagnostic tests, and manage treatment plans.
* Provide assistance in operative cases and respond to emergency situations.

**Patient Education & Psychosocial Support**

* Educate patients/families on care plans and available resources.
* Offer compassionate psychosocial support to patients and their families.

**Information Management**

* Ensure accurate documentation and protect patient information as per regulatory requirements.

**Quality Management**

* Demonstrate moral and ethical behavior, professionalism, and commitment to patient care.
* Ensure compliance with healthcare regulatory requirements and standards.

**Professional Development**

* Engage in projects to maintain and advance professional competency.
* Serve as a mentor and preceptor for students and healthcare professionals.
* Collaborate on research and performance improvement projects.

**Qualifications**

* **Education:** Graduate from an accredited Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant Program.
* **Experience:** Clinical working experience within the specialty/service line preferred.
* **Licensure:** Active PA Certification or Connecticut State Nurse Practitioner License, with additional certifications as required.
* Ready to elevate your career and make a difference in patient care? Apply now to join our integrative healthcare team at YNHHS!

Job Type: Part-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Loan repayment program
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Emergency Medicine

title: Pre-Kindergarten Teacher
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is one of the North East’s largest providers of Early Learning, Before and After School, and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations. We are reinventing accessible and affordable child care for today’s families and creating opportunities for individuals to do what they love (and feel valued while they’re doing it). Join our community to provide the quality program children deserve while pursuing your own professional growth and development.

**We are currently looking for a Pre-Kindergarten Teacher for our 2 Prek classrooms at William E. Cottle School in partnership with the Tuckahoe Union Free School District.**

**PAY: $26 per hour**

**STATUS: 10 months (aligned to district calendar)**

**HOURS: 7 hours/day**


The Pre-K program provides four-year-old children with a universal opportunity to access high-quality pre-kindergarten programs that prepare them for future school success. This position will require a high degree of creativity, cultural awareness, and problem-solving capabilities. The program focuses on child-centered activities, the development of strong foundational skills in early literacy and numeracy, social interactions, and Kindergarten readiness skills. The successful candidate should possess experience with early literacy, multi-disciplinary approaches, and strategies for meeting the needs of diverse learners.

**Responsibilities will always include but are not limited to:**


Plan and implement a developmentally appropriate program for PreK students, meeting UPK School District requirements.


Plan, prepare, and teach well-developed culturally responsive lessons.


Assess, track, and provide relevant and timely feedback on the achievement and developmental needs of students.


Use age-appropriate and positive guidance strategies to teach, encourage, and redirect inappropriate classroom behavior.


Build relationships with staff and families through positive and professional communication, creating a welcoming environment, respecting diversity, and encouraging parent participation in the program.


Work collaboratively with teacher assistants


Design the room layout for success using ECERS (Early Childhood Environment Rating Scale)


Developing activities that promote literacy and math concepts – following the Creative Curriculum


Participating in ongoing in-service and education development opportunities, and participating in the ongoing development and evaluation of the program’s goals and objectives


Requirements:
**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**


Current NYS teaching certificate valid for service in the early childhood grades


Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred)


Experience teaching preschool-age children

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**


To be qualified as a Pre-K teacher, a person must possess either:


(a) New York State Certification Birth-Grade 2 OR


(b) New York State Certification N-6 OR


(c) New York State Certification P, K, 1-6 OR


(d) Bachelor’s Degree & 5-Year Plan

**ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:**


Please note applicants for this position will be required to complete standard background screenings which include fingerprinting, NYS child abuse clearance, physical & TB test


Must pass a full background check, including fingerprinting, references,


Warm, friendly, caring, upbeat personality. Exceptional people skills in dealing with young children, parents, and staff. Professional, reliable, and prompt.


Must have the stamina and physical flexibility (walking, sitting, standing, bending, kneeling, pulling, running, reaching, climbing, lifting, and carrying up to 50 lbs.) without assistance to participate in children’s activities.

**BENEFITS:**


Telehealth Benefits


On-Demand Pay


401(k) for eligible employees


Sick Time Off


Career Development


Certain applicants qualify for tuition assistance, get in touch for more details.


In addition, we offer competitive benefits for our full time employees including:


Paid Holidays


Health, Dental and Vision Insurance


Life Insurance


Short-Term and Long Term Disability Insurance


AFLAC Supplemental Plans


Healthy Kids is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.


This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Healthy Kids Programs makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, visit: healthykidsprograms.com

title: Junior Technical Support Specialist
description:
**Title:** Junior Technical Support Specialist Grade 9 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $75,933.15 (Weekly: $1,348.55 + $111.71 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department**: Information Technology – Help Desk

**Location:** 107 West 33rd Street, Manhattan , New York

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

ITD Helpdesk is seeking a Jr. Technical Support Specialist to provide technical support and customer service to our staff members at the Theory School location. Reporting to the Help Desk Manager, under general supervision, the Jr. Technical Support will be responsible for but not limited to:

* Responsible for all Network Infrastructure, office, and mobile automation under the supervision of IT management at Flushing.
* Provide technical assistance and support for incoming concerns and issues related to systems, software, and hardware.
* Configure and maintain appropriate software and functions according to specifications.
* Check computer hardware (HDD, mouse, keyboard, etc.) to ensure functionality.
* Phone setup and monitoring.
* Hardware/software installation, updates, configuration, troubleshooting, and issue resolution.
* Maintain daily performance of computer systems.
* Run diagnostic problems to resolve problems.
* Resolve technical problems with Local Area Networks (LAN), Wide Area Networks (WAN), and other systems.
* Assist with troubleshooting and upgrade of network and Wi-Fi.
* Provide onsite assistance to troubleshooting, configuration, and maintenance of mainframe, network, desktops, and Windows OS, working along with IT at Flushing.
* Monitor and Support Backup Software Systems.
* Responsible for tracking hardware/software inventory.
* Receive, setup and configure equipment and software.
* Proactively inspect equipment, repair anything not working and inform IT management of anything unable to repair.
* Keep IT management informed of all activities, requests from business and outstanding items.
* Assist in preparation for and conducting Disaster Recovery testing.
* Installation of Projectors, TVs, Speakers, Amplifiers, and Sound Masking
* Installation of Mounts and hardware on various wall types and ceiling types for Projectors, Displays, Speakers and Wireless Microphones
* Dress and route cable from IT closets to device locations (AV Equipment Rack, TV, Projector, Speakers)
* AV/Technical knowledge of current conference room technology.
* Manage content of broadcasts or presentations.
* Oversee microphone placement and conduct sound check.
* Testing of each individual piece of equipment ensures equipment is set to factory specifications to obtain optimum performance and report system problems immediately including solutions and/or recommendations.
* Review schedules for next-day requests to ensure equipment is operational.

**Work Environment and Physical Demands**

* IT work Help Desk Environment with physical demands prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Frequently to lift, carry, reach, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including but not limited to all IT Help Desk Equipment.
* General office work involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.
* In a 7-hour workday, must be able to lift /carry:
* 50 to 100+ pounds occasionally
* 25 to 50 pounds frequently
* 10 to 20 pounds regularly

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position.

**Work Location**

**Theory School located on 107 West 33rd Street NY, NY 10001**

* Approximately ten (10) months out of the year will be in Manhattan beginning the week following Labor Day through the 3rd/4th week of June.
* Shift is Monday-Thursday, 1:00 PM – 9:00 PM, Friday 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM,

**JIBEI located on 158-11 Harry Van Arsdale Jr Ave Fresh Meadows, NY 11365**

* Approximately two (2) months out of the year will be in Fresh Meadows when classes are not in session beginning either the 3rd/4th week of June and ending Friday following Labor day.
* Shift is Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM at our Flushing location during summer break at the Theory School.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel** -- Occasional local travel may be required for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Significant experience with Microsoft Windows and desktop products.
* Experience repairing and replacing desktop computers and component parts.
* Proven experience working with a Windows domain (adding/removing accounts and password resets).
* Experience using hard drive imaging software and web conferencing hardware and software.
* Prior customer service experience.
* Well-versed in using Google, Chrome, Firefox, and Edge in order to assist members working on their systems at home taking online courses.
* Must be a self-starter and possess the ability to work well with others in demanding and stressful situations with tight deadlines.
* Must be a quick learner, take initiative to research possible solutions, and communicate with IT management before taking any action that could possibly render equipment or services unusable.
* Ability to work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment and stay on task.
* Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) to support interactions with, visitors, guests, students, and other stakeholders as well as Management and Staff.
* Knowledge of inventory management is highly desirable, ability to order, stock and track all supplies and equipment utilized in the Center operations and communicate status report.
* Familiarity with the operation of personal computers is essential, particularly e-mail and Microsoft Windows based office programs. (Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc.).

**Desired Skills**

* Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA).
* Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA).
* CompTIA A+ certified.

**HIPAA Compliance Required**

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off.
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.
* Life Insurance.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,933.15 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you able to lift 10 to 50 pounds frequently

Experience:

* Windows: 2 years (Preferred)
* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)
* Inventory management: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) (Preferred)
* CompTIA A+ (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Fresh Meadows, NY 11365 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: ROOM/SUITE ATTENDANT - HOMEWOOD SUITES - MAHWAH(AP)
description:
Description:
**Reports To:** Executive Housekeeper

**Supervises:** N/A

 **Job Purpose:** To maintain cleanliness of all spaces within the hotel.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Make beds in guest rooms.
* Replenish supplies such as drinking glasses, writing supplies and bathroom supplies in guest rooms.
* Clean rooms, hallways, lobbies, lounges, restrooms, corridors, elevators, stairways, and locker rooms and other work areas
* Clean rugs, carpets, upholstered furniture and draperies, using vacuum cleaner.
* Dust furniture and equipment.
* Polish metalwork, such as fixtures and fittings.
* Wash walls, ceilings, woodwork, windows, door panels, and sills.
* Empty wastebaskets, and empties and cleans ashtrays
* Transport trash and waste to disposal area.
* Replace light bulbs.
* Collects soiled linens for laundering and receives and stores linen supplies in linen closet.
* Load articles into washer and adds specified amount of detergent, soap, or other cleaning agent.
* Lift clean, wet articles from washer and places them successively into wringers and driers for measured time cycles.
* Sort dried articles according to identification number or type.
* Fold and place item in appropriate storage bin.
* Other duties as assigned

**Job Skills:**

* Ability to carry out specific oral or written instructions, frequently following a simple routine.
* Ability to perform repetitive actions consistently.


Requirements:
**Education**

* HS Diploma or equivalent

**Experience**

* None

title: Direct Support Professional - Day Programs
description:
Description:
**Living Resources is a non-profit human services agency. Our core purpose is to support and empower individuals with disabilities or other life-challenging conditions to live with dignity, independence, and happiness.**

**Living Resources works with, and for, families by providing peace of mind. All employees are to be respectful and supportive of families. We are working with them as partners, providing care and services.**

**Our Values**: Inclusive, Change Embracer or Innovator, Mentor, Personal growth, Self-determination and Teamwork/Collaboration

**We are looking for people who are:**


Compassionate while caring/supporting others


Kind hearted


Patient


Team Player


Adaptable with changing work days


Reliable and attentive


Eager to learn and grow

**Would you enjoy working in an organization that encourages your personal development? How would you like the flexibility to create the work-life balance you desire?**

**These are just some of the things Living Resources can offer you!**


To work for Living Resources is to make a difference in the lives of others. Living Resources provides individuals with disabilities the support they need to thrive and lead active, full lives. For many Living Resources employees, their work becomes an experience where they find fulfillment and develop both personally and professionally. *Ask our 150+ employees who have been here more than 10 years!*


Our **Day Community Opportunity Program in Rockland County,** is seeking Direct Support Professionals. Do you want to have fun with our individuals who are independent within the community? We love to help them reach their goals by participating within the community, as well as volunteering to reach their short and long term goals. Great opportunity to grow and become part of a great team in Ulster County Day Community Program.

**Schedule: Full Time, Monday - Friday, 8am to 4pm.**


Requirements:
**We would like to speak with those that are:**

* Passionate about making a difference
* At least 18 years of age
* Have a valid NYS Driver's License for transporting individuals to community activities and appointments

**As a Living Resources employee, you can expect:**

* Paid Training
* Generous paid time off (PTO)
* Comprehensive Benefits package including Health (we cover 100% of deductible costs for Health Insurance), Dental & Vision insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Retirement Programs
* Ongoing professional development and training opportunities
* Growth and advancement opportunities within the agency

description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Program Coordinator I
  

**Job Category** URA-AFT Administrative
  

**Department** Undergrad Adm - NB
  

**Overview**
The Division of Enrollment Management at Rutgers University–New Brunswick (EMNB) is comprised of eight student-facing and administrative units: Undergraduate Admissions, Graduate Admissions, the Office of Financial Aid, the Office of the Registrar, and the One Stop Student Services Center, as well as business, information technology, and strategy and analytics administrative teams. The division employs over 100 full-time staff and an additional 200+ student employees to fulfill its mission. The division is driven by research, galvanized by progress, and motivated by a relentless commitment to student access and academic excellence. It works at the intersection of administration and innovation to set enrollment strategy, foster student success, and inform university policy and practice. EM–NB attracts the best and brightest students to Rutgers’ flagship campus, supports them through their time on the banks, and celebrates their graduation each year. Experience working with diverse populations of students, staff and faculty desired.  

  

The Undergraduate Admissions Office serves to engage and enroll undergraduate students who are prepared to thrive, inspired to become active members of the campus community, and who will contribute to the diversity of thought and experiences represented by the institution. The office achieves this through the recruitment, selection, and enrollment of a high-achieving, dynamically talented, and diverse student population. Through programs, communications, and services, Admissions aims to convey the rigor, spirit, and promise of a Rutgers education to the state, the nation, and the world.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Program Coordinator I for the Undergraduate Admissions – NB department.

* Conducts market planning/analysis.

title: Educator Support Specialist
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Educator Support Specialist
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare - Administrative Services
  

**Department** UBHC-AID NJEA
  

**Overview**
Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care (UBHC), established in 1971, offers a full continuum of evidence based behavioral health and addiction services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors throughout New Jersey. UBHC’s 1,060 experienced behavioral health professionals and support staff are dedicated to treatment, prevention, and education. UBHC, one of the largest providers of behavioral health care in the country, has a budget of $260 million and has 15 sites throughout New Jersey. Services are readily accessible and include: inpatient, outpatient, partial hospitalization, screening, crisis stabilization, family/caregiver support, community outreach and case management, supportive housing, supported employment, prevention and consultation, employee assistance programs, and a licensed therapeutic school from preschool through high school.  

  

Specialty services include the New Jersey suicide prevention helpline and peer help lines for police, veterans, active military, teachers, mothers of special needs children and child protective service workers. In FY2016, UBHC treated 16,199 consumers, had 24,502 admissions, and touched the lives of 19,441 individual callers through peer support. In addition, UBHC is the primary mental health training resource for the New Jersey departments of Human Services, Children and Families, and Corrections, delivering 16,000 trainings each year.  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers The State University is seeking an Educator Support Specialist in the Access Center AID NJEA/RING NEA – Corporate of Rutgers University Behavioral Healthcare.  

  

The Primary purpose of the Educator Support Specialist is to provide confidential telephonic support and counseling in support of the AID NJEA/RING NEA mission. Receives telephonic requests for these services, is consumer-friendly, demonstrates counseling skills, and is knowledgeable in education issues. Enters relevant data into the unit’s information system.

* Promptly answers the AID NJEA/RING NEA telephone; makes every effort to respond within three rings.
* Responds to telephone contacts with callers in an appropriately courteous, helpful fashion.
* Responds to telephone referrals, inquiries, and other contacts with professionals, outside agencies, and other parties in a professional and cordial manner.
* Assesses telephone service calls/requests and responds in accordance with prescribed AID NJEA/RING NEA procedures.

title: Mental Health Specialist II Part Time
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Mental Health Specialist II Part Time
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Medical (Clinical)
  

**Department** EOHSI-Banner
  

**Overview**
With its broad and multidisciplinary faculty expertise, the Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute (EOHSI) is an international resource that supports basic and clinical research in environmental health sciences and exposure assessment and fosters associated programs in environmental health education and public policy.  

  

Established in 1986, EOHSI’s major objectives are to:* Advance understanding of the mechanisms by which environmental and occupational chemical exposures impact human health.
* Identify and measure human environmental and occupational exposures to chemicals. Treat populations adversely affected by chemical exposures.
* Develop educational tools describing relative risks of chemical exposures.
* Contribute to public policies related to environmental and occupational chemical risks.
* Offer training programs for environmental health professionals.

  

  

  

The Institute serves as an unbiased source of expertise about environmental problems for communities, employers and governments in all areas of occupational and environmental health, toxicology and risk assessment. EOHSI members are active as advisors to international, national, state and local organizations on public health issues.  

  

Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the state of New Jersey’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. Established in 1766 and celebrating a milestone 250th anniversary in 2016, the university is the eighth oldest higher education institution in the United States. More than 67,000 students and 22,000 faculty and staff learn, work, and serve the public at Rutgers locations across New Jersey and around the world.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey has opening for a Per Diem Staff Nurse for the Clinical Research and Occupational Medicine Division within the Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute, located in Piscataway, NJ. Under Supervision**,** provides administrative support for mental health assessment and treatment for a Federally Contracted Health Program., assists in the planning and support of activities to benefit the patient population, performs related work as required.  

  

Duties include:* Coordinates administrative aspects of program to assure compliance with all funding regulations, procedures, and level of service mandates.
* Perform data entry of existing mental health questionnaires.
* Promotes program in the community, maintaining strong, collaborative relationships with referral sources and collaborating providers
* Input data into multiple databases including but not limited to the EMR system.
* Opportunity to co-facilitate clinical services with doctoral-level psychology interns, externs and Licensed Social Workers.
* Approximately 16 hours will be spent doing data entry under WTC contract. Approximately 6 hours will be spent in conducting group programmatic sessions with lead clinician and other group members.

Experience in various treatment modalities, including individual & group treatment. Knowledge of community resources, social service, and mental health systems. Knowledge of appropriate clinical interventions in a crisis and non-crisis situation.
